segment.source: In Poedit, translators can now read translator added and automatically extracted comments. Messages that are untranslated or fuzzy are marked with a star and a beep is heard when you navigate onto them. (#1811)
segment.target: In Poedit, translators can now read translator added and automatically extracted comments. Messages that are untranslated or fuzzy are marked with a star and a beep is heard when you navigate onto them. (#1811)

segment.source: Support for the HumanWare Brailliant BI and B series displays. (#1990)
segment.target: Support for the HumanWare Brailliant BI and B series displays. (#1990)

segment.source: New languages: Norwegian Bokml, Traditional Chinese (Hong Kong).
segment.target: New languages: Norwegian Bokml, Traditional Chinese (Hong Kong).

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: Commands to describe the current character or to spell the current word or line now will spell in the appropriate language according to the text, if auto language switching is turned on and the appropriate language information is available.
segment.target: Commands to describe the current character or to spell the current word or line now will spell in the appropriate language according to the text, if auto language switching is turned on and the appropriate language information is available.

segment.source: Updated eSpeak speech synthesizer to 1.46.02.
segment.target: Updated eSpeak speech synthesizer to 1.46.02.

segment.source: NVDA will now truncate extremely long (30 characters or greater) names guessed from graphic and link URLs as they are most likely garbage that gets in the way of reading. (#1989)
segment.target: NVDA will now truncate extremely long (30 characters or greater) names guessed from graphic and link URLs as they are most likely garbage that gets in the way of reading. (#1989)

segment.source: Some information displayed in braille has been abbreviated. (#1955, #2043)
segment.target: Some information displayed in braille has been abbreviated. (#1955, #2043)

segment.source: When the caret or review cursor moves, braille is now scrolled in the same way as when it is manually scrolled. This makes it more appropriate when braille is configured to read by paragraphs and/or avoid splitting words. (#1996)
segment.target: When the caret or review cursor moves, braille is now scrolled in the same way as when it is manually scrolled. This makes it more appropriate when braille is configured to read by paragraphs and/or avoid splitting words. (#1996)

segment.source: Updated to new Spanish grade 1 braille translation table.
segment.target: Updated to new Spanish grade 1 braille translation table.

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.4.1.
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.4.1.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: In Windows 8, focus is no longer incorrectly moved away from the Windows Explorer search field, which was not allowing NVDA to interact with it.
segment.target: In Windows 8, focus is no longer incorrectly moved away from the Windows Explorer search field, which was not allowing NVDA to interact with it.

segment.source: Major performance improvements when reading and navigating Microsoft Word documents while automatic reporting of formatting is enabled, thus now making it quite comfortable to proof read formatting etc. Performance may be also improved over all for some users.
segment.target: Major performance improvements when reading and navigating Microsoft Word documents while automatic reporting of formatting is enabled, thus now making it quite comfortable to proof read formatting etc. Performance may be also improved over all for some users.

segment.source: Browse mode is now used for full screen Adobe Flash content.
segment.target: Browse mode is now used for full screen Adobe Flash content.

segment.source: Fixed poor audio quality in some cases when using Microsoft Speech API version 5 voices with the audio output device set to something other than the default (Microsoft Sound Mapper). (#749)
segment.target: Fixed poor audio quality in some cases when using Microsoft Speech API version 5 voices with the audio output device set to something other than the default (Microsoft Sound Mapper). (#749)

segment.source: Again allow NVDA to be used with the "no speech" synthesizer, relying purely on braille or the speech viewer. (#1963)
segment.target: Again allow NVDA to be used with the "no speech" synthesizer, relying purely on braille or the speech viewer. (#1963)

segment.source: Object navigation commands no longer report "No children" and "No parents", but instead report messages consistent with the documentation.
segment.target: Object navigation commands no longer report "No children" and "No parents", but instead report messages consistent with the documentation.

segment.source: When NVDA is configured to use a language other than English, the name of the tab key is now reported in the correct language.
segment.target: When NVDA is configured to use a language other than English, the name of the tab key is now reported in the correct language.

segment.source: In Mozilla Gecko (e.g. Firefox), NVDA no longer intermittently switches to browse mode while navigating menus in documents. (#2025)
segment.target: In Mozilla Gecko (e.g. Firefox), NVDA no longer intermittently switches to browse mode while navigating menus in documents. (#2025)

segment.source: In Calculator, the backspace key now reports the updated result instead of reporting nothing. (#2030)
segment.target: In Calculator, the backspace key now reports the updated result instead of reporting nothing. (#2030)

segment.source: In browse mode, the move mouse to current navigator object command now routes to the center of the object at the review cursor instead of the top left, making it more accurate it some cases. (#2029)
segment.target: In browse mode, the move mouse to current navigator object command now routes to the center of the object at the review cursor instead of the top left, making it more accurate it some cases. (#2029)

segment.source: In browse mode with automatic focus mode for focus changes enabled, focusing on a toolbar will now switch to focus mode. (#1339)
segment.target: In browse mode with automatic focus mode for focus changes enabled, focusing on a toolbar will now switch to focus mode. (#1339)

segment.source: The report title command works correctly again in Adobe Reader.
segment.target: The report title command works correctly again in Adobe Reader.

segment.source: With automatic focus mode for focus changes enabled, focus mode is now correctly used for focused table cells; e.g. in ARIA grids. (#1763)
segment.target: With automatic focus mode for focus changes enabled, focus mode is now correctly used for focused table cells; e.g. in ARIA grids. (#1763)

segment.source: In iTunes, position information in certain lists is now reported correctly.
segment.target: In iTunes, position information in certain lists is now reported correctly.

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, some links are no longer treated as containing read-only editable text fields.
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, some links are no longer treated as containing read-only editable text fields.

segment.source: The labels of some editable text fields are no longer incorrectly included when reporting the text of a dialog. (#1960)
segment.target: The labels of some editable text fields are no longer incorrectly included when reporting the text of a dialog. (#1960)

segment.source: The description of groupings is once again reported if reporting of object descriptions is enabled.
segment.target: The description of groupings is once again reported if reporting of object descriptions is enabled.

segment.source: The human readable sizes are now included in the text of the Windows Explorer drive properties dialog.
segment.target: The human readable sizes are now included in the text of the Windows Explorer drive properties dialog.

segment.source: Double reporting of property page text has been suppressed in some cases. (#218)
segment.target: Double reporting of property page text has been suppressed in some cases. (#218)

segment.source: Improved tracking of the caret in editable text fields which rely on text written to the screen. In particular, this improves editing in the Microsoft Excel cell editor and the Eudora message editor. (#1658)
segment.target: Improved tracking of the caret in editable text fields which rely on text written to the screen. In particular, this improves editing in the Microsoft Excel cell editor and the Eudora message editor. (#1658)

segment.source: In Firefox 11, the move to containing virtual buffer command (NVDA+control+space) now works as it should to escape embedded objects such as Flash content.
segment.target: In Firefox 11, the move to containing virtual buffer command (NVDA+control+space) now works as it should to escape embedded objects such as Flash content.

segment.source: NVDA now restarts itself correctly (e.g. after changing the configured language) when it is located in a directory which contains non-ASCII characters. (#2079)
segment.target: NVDA now restarts itself correctly (e.g. after changing the configured language) when it is located in a directory which contains non-ASCII characters. (#2079)

segment.source: Braille correctly respects the settings for reporting of object shortcut keys, position information and descriptions.
segment.target: Braille correctly respects the settings for reporting of object shortcut keys, position information and descriptions.

segment.source: In Mozilla applications, switching between browse and focus modes is no longer slow with braille enabled. (#2095)
segment.target: In Mozilla applications, switching between browse and focus modes is no longer slow with braille enabled. (#2095)

segment.source: Routing the cursor to the space at the end of the line/paragraph using braille cursor routing keys in some editable text fields now works correctly instead of routing to the start of the text. (#2096)
segment.target: Routing the cursor to the space at the end of the line/paragraph using braille cursor routing keys in some editable text fields now works correctly instead of routing to the start of the text. (#2096)

segment.source: NVDA again works correctly with the Audiologic Tts3 synthesizer. (#2109)
segment.target: NVDA again works correctly with the Audiologic Tts3 synthesizer. (#2109)

segment.source: Microsoft Word documents are correctly treated as multi-line. This causes braille to behave more appropriately when a document is focused.
segment.target: Microsoft Word documents are correctly treated as multi-line. This causes braille to behave more appropriately when a document is focused.

segment.source: In Microsoft Internet Explorer, errors no longer occur when focusing on certain rare controls. (#2121)
segment.target: In Microsoft Internet Explorer, errors no longer occur when focusing on certain rare controls. (#2121)

segment.source: Changing the pronunciation of punctuation/symbols by the user will now take effect straight away, rather than requiring NVDA to be restarted or auto language switching to be disabled.
segment.target: Changing the pronunciation of punctuation/symbols by the user will now take effect straight away, rather than requiring NVDA to be restarted or auto language switching to be disabled.

segment.source: When using eSpeak, speech no longer goes silent in some cases in the Save As dialog of the NVDA Log Viewer. (#2145)
segment.target: When using eSpeak, speech no longer goes silent in some cases in the Save As dialog of the NVDA Log Viewer. (#2145)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: There is now a remote Python console for situations where remote debugging is useful. See the Developer Guide for details.
segment.target: There is now a remote Python console for situations where remote debugging is useful. See the Developer Guide for details.

segment.source: The base path of NVDA's code is now stripped from tracebacks in the log to improve readability. (#1880)
segment.target: The base path of NVDA's code is now stripped from tracebacks in the log to improve readability. (#1880)

segment.source: TextInfo objects now have an activate() method to activate the position represented by the TextInfo.
segment.target: TextInfo objects now have an activate() method to activate the position represented by the TextInfo.

segment.source: This is used by braille to activate the position using cursor routing keys on a braille display. However, there may be other callers in future.
segment.target: This is used by braille to activate the position using cursor routing keys on a braille display. However, there may be other callers in future.

segment.source: TreeInterceptors and NVDAObjects which only expose one page of text at a time can support automatic page turns during say all by using the textInfos.DocumentWithPageTurns mix-in. (#1978)
segment.target: TreeInterceptors and NVDAObjects which only expose one page of text at a time can support automatic page turns during say all by using the textInfos.DocumentWithPageTurns mix-in. (#1978)

segment.source: Several control and output constants have been renamed or moved. (#228)
segment.target: Several control and output constants have been renamed or moved. (#228)

segment.source: speech.REASON_* constants have been moved to controlTypes.
segment.target: speech.REASON_* constants have been moved to controlTypes.

segment.source: In controlTypes, speechRoleLabels and speechStateLabels have been renamed to just roleLabels and stateLabels, respectively.
segment.target: In controlTypes, speechRoleLabels and speechStateLabels have been renamed to just roleLabels and stateLabels, respectively.

segment.source: Braille output is now logged at level input/output. First, the untranslated text of all regions is logged, followed by the braille cells of the window being displayed. (#2102)
segment.target: Braille output is now logged at level input/output. First, the untranslated text of all regions is logged, followed by the braille cells of the window being displayed. (#2102)

segment.source: subclasses of the sapi5 synthDriver can now override _getVoiceTokens and extend init to support custom voice tokens such as with sapi.spObjectTokenCategory to get tokens from a custom registry location.
segment.target: subclasses of the sapi5 synthDriver can now override _getVoiceTokens and extend init to support custom voice tokens such as with sapi.spObjectTokenCategory to get tokens from a custom registry location.

segment.source: Highlights of this release include automatic speech language switching when reading documents with appropriate language information; support for 64 bit Java Runtime Environments; reporting of text formatting in browse mode in Mozilla applications; better handling of application crashes and freezes; and initial fixes for Windows 8.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include automatic speech language switching when reading documents with appropriate language information; support for 64 bit Java Runtime Environments; reporting of text formatting in browse mode in Mozilla applications; better handling of application crashes and freezes; and initial fixes for Windows 8.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: NVDA can now change the eSpeak synthesizer language on the fly when reading certain web/pdf documents with appropriate language information. Automatic language/dialect switching can be toggled on and off from the Voice Settings dialog. (#845)
segment.target: NVDA can now change the eSpeak synthesizer language on the fly when reading certain web/pdf documents with appropriate language information. Automatic language/dialect switching can be toggled on and off from the Voice Settings dialog. (#845)

segment.source: Java Access Bridge 2.0.2 is now supported, which includes support for 64 bit Java Runtime Environments.
segment.target: Java Access Bridge 2.0.2 is now supported, which includes support for 64 bit Java Runtime Environments.

segment.source: In Mozilla Gecko (e.g. Firefox) Heading levels are now announced when using object navigation.
segment.target: In Mozilla Gecko (e.g. Firefox) Heading levels are now announced when using object navigation.

segment.source: Text formatting can now be reported when using browse mode in Mozilla Gecko (e.g. Firefox and Thunderbird). (#394)
segment.target: Text formatting can now be reported when using browse mode in Mozilla Gecko (e.g. Firefox and Thunderbird). (#394)

segment.source: Text with underline and/or strikethrough can now be detected and reported in standard IAccessible2 text controls such as in Mozilla applications.
segment.target: Text with underline and/or strikethrough can now be detected and reported in standard IAccessible2 text controls such as in Mozilla applications.

segment.source: In browse mode in Adobe Reader, table row and column counts are now reported.
segment.target: In browse mode in Adobe Reader, table row and column counts are now reported.

segment.source: Added support for the Microsoft Speech Platform synthesizer. (#1735)
segment.target: Added support for the Microsoft Speech Platform synthesizer. (#1735)

segment.source: Page and line numbers are now reported for the caret in IBM Lotus Symphony. (#1632)
segment.target: Page and line numbers are now reported for the caret in IBM Lotus Symphony. (#1632)

segment.source: The percentage of how much the pitch changes when speaking a capital letter is now configurable from the voice settings dialog. However, this does replace the older raise pitch for capitals checkbox (therefore to turn off this feature set the percentage to 0). (#255)
segment.target: The percentage of how much the pitch changes when speaking a capital letter is now configurable from the voice settings dialog. However, this does replace the older raise pitch for capitals checkbox (therefore to turn off this feature set the percentage to 0). (#255)

segment.source: Text and background color is now included in the reporting of formatting for cells in Microsoft Excel. (#1655)
segment.target: Text and background color is now included in the reporting of formatting for cells in Microsoft Excel. (#1655)

segment.source: In applications using the Java Access Bridge, the activate current navigator object command now works on controls where appropriate. (#1744)
segment.target: In applications using the Java Access Bridge, the activate current navigator object command now works on controls where appropriate. (#1744)

segment.source: New language: Tamil.
segment.target: New language: Tamil.

segment.source: Basic support for Design Science MathPlayer.
segment.target: Basic support for Design Science MathPlayer.

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: NVDA will now restart itself if it crashes.
segment.target: NVDA will now restart itself if it crashes.

segment.source: Some information displayed in braille has been abbreviated. (#1288)
segment.target: Some information displayed in braille has been abbreviated. (#1288)

segment.source: the Read active window script (NVDA+b) has been improved to filter out unuseful controls and also is now much more easy to silence. (#1499)
segment.target: the Read active window script (NVDA+b) has been improved to filter out unuseful controls and also is now much more easy to silence. (#1499)

segment.source: Automatic say all when a browse mode document loads is now optional via a setting in the Browse Mode settings dialog. (#414)
segment.target: Automatic say all when a browse mode document loads is now optional via a setting in the Browse Mode settings dialog. (#414)

segment.source: When trying to read the status bar (Desktop NVDA+end), If a real status bar object cannot be located, NVDA will instead resort to using the bottom line of text written to the display for the active application. (#649)
segment.target: When trying to read the status bar (Desktop NVDA+end), If a real status bar object cannot be located, NVDA will instead resort to using the bottom line of text written to the display for the active application. (#649)

segment.source: When reading with say all in browse mode documents, NVDA will now pause at the end of headings and other block-level elements, rather than speaking the text together with the next lot of text as one long sentence.
segment.target: When reading with say all in browse mode documents, NVDA will now pause at the end of headings and other block-level elements, rather than speaking the text together with the next lot of text as one long sentence.

segment.source: In browse mode, pressing enter or space on a tab now activates it instead of switching to focus mode. (#1760)
segment.target: In browse mode, pressing enter or space on a tab now activates it instead of switching to focus mode. (#1760)

segment.source: Updated eSpeak speech synthesizer to 1.45.47.
segment.target: Updated eSpeak speech synthesizer to 1.45.47.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: NVDA no longer shows bullets or numbering for lists in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls when the author has indicated that these should not be shown (i.e. the list style is "none"). (#1671)
segment.target: NVDA no longer shows bullets or numbering for lists in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls when the author has indicated that these should not be shown (i.e. the list style is "none"). (#1671)

segment.source: Restarting NVDA when it has frozen (e.g. by pressing control+alt+n) no longer exits the previous copy without starting a new one.
segment.target: Restarting NVDA when it has frozen (e.g. by pressing control+alt+n) no longer exits the previous copy without starting a new one.

segment.source: Pressing backspace or arrow keys in a Windows command console no longer causes strange results in some cases. (#1612)
segment.target: Pressing backspace or arrow keys in a Windows command console no longer causes strange results in some cases. (#1612)

segment.source: The selected item in WPF combo boxes (and possibly some other combo boxes exposed using UI Automation) which do not allow text editing is now reported correctly.
segment.target: The selected item in WPF combo boxes (and possibly some other combo boxes exposed using UI Automation) which do not allow text editing is now reported correctly.

segment.source: In browse mode in Adobe Reader, it is now always possible to move to the next row from the header row and vice versa using the move to next row and move to previous row commands. Also, the header row is no longer reported as row 0. (#1731)
segment.target: In browse mode in Adobe Reader, it is now always possible to move to the next row from the header row and vice versa using the move to next row and move to previous row commands. Also, the header row is no longer reported as row 0. (#1731)

segment.source: In browse mode in Adobe Reader, it is now possible to move to (and therefore past) empty cells in a table.
segment.target: In browse mode in Adobe Reader, it is now possible to move to (and therefore past) empty cells in a table.

segment.source: Pointless position information (e.g. 0 of 0 level 0) is no longer reported in braille.
segment.target: Pointless position information (e.g. 0 of 0 level 0) is no longer reported in braille.

segment.source: When braille is tethered to review, it is now able to show content in flat review. (#1711)
segment.target: When braille is tethered to review, it is now able to show content in flat review. (#1711)

segment.source: A text control's text is no longer presented twice on a braille display in some cases, e.g. scrolling back from the start of Wordpad documents.
segment.target: A text control's text is no longer presented twice on a braille display in some cases, e.g. scrolling back from the start of Wordpad documents.

segment.source: In browse mode in Internet Explorer, pressing enter on a file upload button now correctly presents the dialog to choose a file to upload instead of switching to focus mode. (#1720)
segment.target: In browse mode in Internet Explorer, pressing enter on a file upload button now correctly presents the dialog to choose a file to upload instead of switching to focus mode. (#1720)

segment.source: Dynamic content changes such as in Dos consoles are no longer announced if sleep mode for that application is currently on. (#1662)
segment.target: Dynamic content changes such as in Dos consoles are no longer announced if sleep mode for that application is currently on. (#1662)

segment.source: In browse mode, the behaviour of alt+upArrow and alt+downArrow to collapse and expand combo boxes has been improved. (#1630)
segment.target: In browse mode, the behaviour of alt+upArrow and alt+downArrow to collapse and expand combo boxes has been improved. (#1630)

segment.source: NVDA now recovers from many more situations such as applications that stop responding which previously caused it to freeze completely. (#1408)
segment.target: NVDA now recovers from many more situations such as applications that stop responding which previously caused it to freeze completely. (#1408)

segment.source: For Mozilla Gecko (Firefox etc) browse mode documents NVDA will no longer fail to render text in a very specific situation where an element is styled as display:table. (#1373)
segment.target: For Mozilla Gecko (Firefox etc) browse mode documents NVDA will no longer fail to render text in a very specific situation where an element is styled as display:table. (#1373)

segment.source: NVDA will no longer announce label controls when focus moves inside of them. Stops double announcements of labels for some form fields in Firefox (Gecko) and Internet Explorer (MSHTML). (#1650)
segment.target: NVDA will no longer announce label controls when focus moves inside of them. Stops double announcements of labels for some form fields in Firefox (Gecko) and Internet Explorer (MSHTML). (#1650)

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to read a cell in Microsoft Excel after pasting in to it with control+v. (#1781)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to read a cell in Microsoft Excel after pasting in to it with control+v. (#1781)

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, extraneous information about the document is no longer announced when moving to a control on a different page in focus mode. (#1659)
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, extraneous information about the document is no longer announced when moving to a control on a different page in focus mode. (#1659)

segment.source: In browse mode in Mozilla Gecko applications (e.g. Firefox), toggle buttons are now detected and reported correctly. (#1757)
segment.target: In browse mode in Mozilla Gecko applications (e.g. Firefox), toggle buttons are now detected and reported correctly. (#1757)

segment.source: NVDA can now correctly read the Windows Explorer Address Bar in Windows 8 developer preview.
segment.target: NVDA can now correctly read the Windows Explorer Address Bar in Windows 8 developer preview.

segment.source: NVDA will no longer crash apps such as winver and wordpad in Windows 8 developer preview due to bad glyph translations.
segment.target: NVDA will no longer crash apps such as winver and wordpad in Windows 8 developer preview due to bad glyph translations.

segment.source: In browse mode in applications using Mozilla Gecko 10 and later (e.g. Firefox 10), the cursor is more often positioned correctly when loading a page with a target anchor. (#360)
segment.target: In browse mode in applications using Mozilla Gecko 10 and later (e.g. Firefox 10), the cursor is more often positioned correctly when loading a page with a target anchor. (#360)

segment.source: In browse mode in Mozilla Gecko applications (e.g. Firefox), labels for image maps are now rendered.
segment.target: In browse mode in Mozilla Gecko applications (e.g. Firefox), labels for image maps are now rendered.

segment.source: With mouse tracking enabled, moving the mouse over certain editable text fields (such as in Synaptics Pointing Device Settings and SpeechLab SpeakText) no longer causes the application to crash. (#672)
segment.target: With mouse tracking enabled, moving the mouse over certain editable text fields (such as in Synaptics Pointing Device Settings and SpeechLab SpeakText) no longer causes the application to crash. (#672)

segment.source: NVDA now functions correctly in several about dialogs in applications distributed with Windows XP, including the About dialog in Notepad and the About Windows dialog. (#1853, #1855)
segment.target: NVDA now functions correctly in several about dialogs in applications distributed with Windows XP, including the About dialog in Notepad and the About Windows dialog. (#1853, #1855)

segment.source: Fixed reviewing by word in Windows Edit controls. (#1877)
segment.target: Fixed reviewing by word in Windows Edit controls. (#1877)

segment.source: Moving out of an editable text field with leftArrow, upArrow or pageUp while in focus mode now correctly switches to browse mode when automatic focus mode for caret movement is enabled. (#1733)
segment.target: Moving out of an editable text field with leftArrow, upArrow or pageUp while in focus mode now correctly switches to browse mode when automatic focus mode for caret movement is enabled. (#1733)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: NVDA can now instruct speech synthesizers to switch languages for particular sections of speech.
segment.target: NVDA can now instruct speech synthesizers to switch languages for particular sections of speech.

segment.source: To support this, drivers must handle speech.LangChangeCommand in sequences past to SynthDriver.speak().
segment.target: To support this, drivers must handle speech.LangChangeCommand in sequences past to SynthDriver.speak().

segment.source: SynthDriver objects should also provide the language argument to VoiceInfo objects (or override the language attribute to retrieve the current language). Otherwise, NVDA's user interface language will be used.
segment.target: SynthDriver objects should also provide the language argument to VoiceInfo objects (or override the language attribute to retrieve the current language). Otherwise, NVDA's user interface language will be used.

segment.source: Highlights of this release include major improvements concerning punctuation and symbols, including configurable levels, custom labelling and character descriptions; no pauses at the end of lines during say all; improved support for ARIA in Internet Explorer; better support for XFA/LiveCycle PDF documents in Adobe Reader; access to text written to the screen in more applications; and access to formatting and color information for text written to the screen.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include major improvements concerning punctuation and symbols, including configurable levels, custom labelling and character descriptions; no pauses at the end of lines during say all; improved support for ARIA in Internet Explorer; better support for XFA/LiveCycle PDF documents in Adobe Reader; access to text written to the screen in more applications; and access to formatting and color information for text written to the screen.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: It is now possible to hear the description for any given character by pressing the review current character script twice in quick succession. For English characters this is the standard English phonetic alphabet. For pictographic languages such as traditional Chinese, one or more example phrases using the given symbol are provided. Also pressing review current word or review current line three times will spell the word/line using the first of these descriptions. (#55)
segment.target: It is now possible to hear the description for any given character by pressing the review current character script twice in quick succession. For English characters this is the standard English phonetic alphabet. For pictographic languages such as traditional Chinese, one or more example phrases using the given symbol are provided. Also pressing review current word or review current line three times will spell the word/line using the first of these descriptions. (#55)

segment.source: More text can be seen in flat review for applications such as Mozilla Thunderbird that write their text directly to the display as glyphs.
segment.target: More text can be seen in flat review for applications such as Mozilla Thunderbird that write their text directly to the display as glyphs.

segment.source: It is now possible to choose from several levels of punctuation and symbol announcement. (#332)
segment.target: It is now possible to choose from several levels of punctuation and symbol announcement. (#332)

segment.source: When punctuation or other symbols are repeated more than four times, the number of repetitions is now announced instead of speaking the repeated symbols. (#43)
segment.target: When punctuation or other symbols are repeated more than four times, the number of repetitions is now announced instead of speaking the repeated symbols. (#43)

segment.source: New braille translation tables: Norwegian 8 dot computer braille, Ethiopic grade 1, Slovene grade 1, Serbian grade 1. (#1456)
segment.target: New braille translation tables: Norwegian 8 dot computer braille, Ethiopic grade 1, Slovene grade 1, Serbian grade 1. (#1456)

segment.source: Speech no longer unnaturally pauses at the end of each line when using the say all command. (#149)
segment.target: Speech no longer unnaturally pauses at the end of each line when using the say all command. (#149)

segment.source: NVDA will now announce whether something is sorted (according to the aria-sort property) in web browsers. (#1500)
segment.target: NVDA will now announce whether something is sorted (according to the aria-sort property) in web browsers. (#1500)

segment.source: Unicode Braille Patterns are now displayed correctly on braille displays. (#1505)
segment.target: Unicode Braille Patterns are now displayed correctly on braille displays. (#1505)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls when focus moves inside a group of controls (surrounded by a fieldset), NVDA will now announce the name of the group (the legend). (#535)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls when focus moves inside a group of controls (surrounded by a fieldset), NVDA will now announce the name of the group (the legend). (#535)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, the aria-labelledBy and aria-describedBy properties are now honoured.
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, the aria-labelledBy and aria-describedBy properties are now honoured.

segment.source: in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, support for ARIA list, gridcell, slider and progressbar controls has been improved.
segment.target: in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, support for ARIA list, gridcell, slider and progressbar controls has been improved.

segment.source: Users can now change the pronunciation of punctuation and other symbols, as well as the symbol level at which they are spoken. (#271, #1516)
segment.target: Users can now change the pronunciation of punctuation and other symbols, as well as the symbol level at which they are spoken. (#271, #1516)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, the name of the active sheet is now reported when switching sheets with control+pageUp or control+pageDown. (#760)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, the name of the active sheet is now reported when switching sheets with control+pageUp or control+pageDown. (#760)

segment.source: When navigating a table in Microsoft Word with the tab key NVDA will now announce the current cell as you move. (#159)
segment.target: When navigating a table in Microsoft Word with the tab key NVDA will now announce the current cell as you move. (#159)

segment.source: You can now configure whether table cell coordinates are reported from the Document Formatting preferences dialog. (#719)
segment.target: You can now configure whether table cell coordinates are reported from the Document Formatting preferences dialog. (#719)

segment.source: NVDA can now detect formatting and color for text written to the screen.
segment.target: NVDA can now detect formatting and color for text written to the screen.

segment.source: In the Outlook Express/Windows Mail/Windows Live Mail message list, NVDA will now announce the fact that a message is unread and also if it's expanded or collapsed in the case of conversation threads. (#868)
segment.target: In the Outlook Express/Windows Mail/Windows Live Mail message list, NVDA will now announce the fact that a message is unread and also if it's expanded or collapsed in the case of conversation threads. (#868)

segment.source: eSpeak now has a rate boost setting which triples the speaking rate.
segment.target: eSpeak now has a rate boost setting which triples the speaking rate.

segment.source: Support for the calendar control found in the Date and Time Information dialog accessed from the Windows 7 clock. (#1637)
segment.target: Support for the calendar control found in the Date and Time Information dialog accessed from the Windows 7 clock. (#1637)

segment.source: Additional key bindings have been added for the MDV Lilli braille display. (#241)
segment.target: Additional key bindings have been added for the MDV Lilli braille display. (#241)

segment.source: New languages: Bulgarian, Albanian.
segment.target: New languages: Bulgarian, Albanian.

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: To move the caret to the review cursor, now press the move focus to navigator object script (desktop NVDA+shift+numpadMinus, laptop NVDA+shift+backspace) twice in quick succession. This frees up more keys on the keyboard. (#837)
segment.target: To move the caret to the review cursor, now press the move focus to navigator object script (desktop NVDA+shift+numpadMinus, laptop NVDA+shift+backspace) twice in quick succession. This frees up more keys on the keyboard. (#837)

segment.source: To hear the decimal and hexadecimal representation of the character under the review cursor, now press review current character three times rather than twice, as twice now speaks the character description.
segment.target: To hear the decimal and hexadecimal representation of the character under the review cursor, now press review current character three times rather than twice, as twice now speaks the character description.

segment.source: Updated eSpeak speech synthesiser to 1.45.03. (#1465)
segment.target: Updated eSpeak speech synthesiser to 1.45.03. (#1465)

segment.source: Layout tables are no longer announced in Mozilla Gecko applications while moving the focus when in focus mode or outside of a document.
segment.target: Layout tables are no longer announced in Mozilla Gecko applications while moving the focus when in focus mode or outside of a document.

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, browse mode now works for documents inside ARIA applications. (#1452)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, browse mode now works for documents inside ARIA applications. (#1452)

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.3.0.
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.3.0.

segment.source: When in browse mode and jumping to a control with quicknav or focus, the description of the control is now announced if it has one.
segment.target: When in browse mode and jumping to a control with quicknav or focus, the description of the control is now announced if it has one.

segment.source: Progress bars are now announced in brows mode.
segment.target: Progress bars are now announced in brows mode.

segment.source: Nodes marked with an ARIA role of presentation in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls are now filtered out of simple review and the focus ancestry.
segment.target: Nodes marked with an ARIA role of presentation in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls are now filtered out of simple review and the focus ancestry.

segment.source: NVDA's user interface and documentation now refer to virtual buffers as browse mode, as the term "virtual buffer" is rather meaningless to most users. (#1509)
segment.target: NVDA's user interface and documentation now refer to virtual buffers as browse mode, as the term "virtual buffer" is rather meaningless to most users. (#1509)

segment.source: When the user wishes to copy their user settings to the system profile for use on the logon screen, etc., and their settings contain custom plugins, they are now warned that this could be a security risk. (#1426)
segment.target: When the user wishes to copy their user settings to the system profile for use on the logon screen, etc., and their settings contain custom plugins, they are now warned that this could be a security risk. (#1426)

segment.source: The NVDA service no longer starts and stops NVDA on user input desktops.
segment.target: The NVDA service no longer starts and stops NVDA on user input desktops.

segment.source: On Windows XP and Windows Vista, NVDA no longer makes use of UI Automation even if it is available via the platform update. Although using UI Automation can improve the accessibility of some modern applications, on XP and Vista there were too many freezes, crashes and over all performance loss while using it. (#1437)
segment.target: On Windows XP and Windows Vista, NVDA no longer makes use of UI Automation even if it is available via the platform update. Although using UI Automation can improve the accessibility of some modern applications, on XP and Vista there were too many freezes, crashes and over all performance loss while using it. (#1437)

segment.source: In applications using Mozilla Gecko 2 and later (such as Firefox 4 and later), a document can now be read in browse mode before it is fully finished loading.
segment.target: In applications using Mozilla Gecko 2 and later (such as Firefox 4 and later), a document can now be read in browse mode before it is fully finished loading.

segment.source: NVDA now announces the state of a container when focus moves to a control inside it (e.g. if focus moves inside a document that is still loading it will report it as busy).
segment.target: NVDA now announces the state of a container when focus moves to a control inside it (e.g. if focus moves inside a document that is still loading it will report it as busy).

segment.source: NVDA's user interface and documentation no longer use the terms "first child" and "parent" with respect to object navigation, as these terms are confusing for many users.
segment.target: NVDA's user interface and documentation no longer use the terms "first child" and "parent" with respect to object navigation, as these terms are confusing for many users.

segment.source: Collapsed is no longer reported for some menu items which have sub-menus.
segment.target: Collapsed is no longer reported for some menu items which have sub-menus.

segment.source: The reportCurrentFormatting script (NVDA+f) now reports the formatting at the position of the review cursor rather than the system caret / focus. As by default the review cursor follows the caret, most people should not notice a difference. However this now enables the user to find out the formatting when moving the review cursor, such as in flat review.
segment.target: The reportCurrentFormatting script (NVDA+f) now reports the formatting at the position of the review cursor rather than the system caret / focus. As by default the review cursor follows the caret, most people should not notice a difference. However this now enables the user to find out the formatting when moving the review cursor, such as in flat review.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: Collapsing combo boxes in browse mode documents when focus mode has been forced with NVDA+space no longer auto-switches back to browse mode. (#1386)
segment.target: Collapsing combo boxes in browse mode documents when focus mode has been forced with NVDA+space no longer auto-switches back to browse mode. (#1386)

segment.source: In Gecko (e.g. Firefox) and MSHTML (e.g. Internet Explorer) documents, NVDA now correctly renders certain text on the same line which was previously rendered on separate lines. (#1378)
segment.target: In Gecko (e.g. Firefox) and MSHTML (e.g. Internet Explorer) documents, NVDA now correctly renders certain text on the same line which was previously rendered on separate lines. (#1378)

segment.source: When Braille is tethered to review and the navigator object is moved to a browse mode document, either manually or due to a focus change, braille will appropriately show the browse mode content. (#1406, #1407)
segment.target: When Braille is tethered to review and the navigator object is moved to a browse mode document, either manually or due to a focus change, braille will appropriately show the browse mode content. (#1406, #1407)

segment.source: When speaking of punctuation is disabled, certain punctuation is no longer incorrectly spoken when using some synthesisers. (#332)
segment.target: When speaking of punctuation is disabled, certain punctuation is no longer incorrectly spoken when using some synthesisers. (#332)

segment.source: Problems no longer occur when loading configuration for synthesisers which do not support the voice setting such as Audiologic Tts3. (#1347)
segment.target: Problems no longer occur when loading configuration for synthesisers which do not support the voice setting such as Audiologic Tts3. (#1347)

segment.source: The Skype Extras menu is now read correctly. (#648)
segment.target: The Skype Extras menu is now read correctly. (#648)

segment.source: Checking the Brightness controls volume checkbox in the Mouse Settings dialog should no longer cause a major lag for beeps when moving the mouse around the screen on Windows Vista/Windows 7 with Aero enabled. (#1183)
segment.target: Checking the Brightness controls volume checkbox in the Mouse Settings dialog should no longer cause a major lag for beeps when moving the mouse around the screen on Windows Vista/Windows 7 with Aero enabled. (#1183)

segment.source: When NVDA is configured to use the laptop keyboard layout, NVDA+delete now works as documented to report the dimensions of the current navigator object. (#1498)
segment.target: When NVDA is configured to use the laptop keyboard layout, NVDA+delete now works as documented to report the dimensions of the current navigator object. (#1498)

segment.source: NVDA now Appropriately honours the aria-selected attribute in Internet Explorer documents.
segment.target: NVDA now Appropriately honours the aria-selected attribute in Internet Explorer documents.

segment.source: When NVDA automatically switches to focus mode in browse mode documents, it now announces information about the context of the focus. For example, if a list box item receives focus, the list box will be announced first. (#1491)
segment.target: When NVDA automatically switches to focus mode in browse mode documents, it now announces information about the context of the focus. For example, if a list box item receives focus, the list box will be announced first. (#1491)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, ARIA listbox controls are now treeted as lists, rather than list items.
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, ARIA listbox controls are now treeted as lists, rather than list items.

segment.source: When a read-only editable text control receives focus, NVDA now reports that it is read-only. (#1436)
segment.target: When a read-only editable text control receives focus, NVDA now reports that it is read-only. (#1436)

segment.source: In browse mode, NVDA now behaves correctly with respect to read-only editable text fields.
segment.target: In browse mode, NVDA now behaves correctly with respect to read-only editable text fields.

segment.source: In browse mode documents, NVDA no longer incorrectly switches out of focus mode when aria-activedescendant is set; e.g. when the completion list appeared in some auto complete controls.
segment.target: In browse mode documents, NVDA no longer incorrectly switches out of focus mode when aria-activedescendant is set; e.g. when the completion list appeared in some auto complete controls.

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, the name of controls is now reported when moving focus or using quick navigation in browse mode.
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, the name of controls is now reported when moving focus or using quick navigation in browse mode.

segment.source: In XFA PDF documents in Adobe Reader, buttons, links and graphics are now rendered correctly.
segment.target: In XFA PDF documents in Adobe Reader, buttons, links and graphics are now rendered correctly.

segment.source: In XFA PDF documents in Adobe Reader, all elements are now rendered on separate lines. This change was made because large sections (sometimes even the entire document) were being rendered without breaks due to the general lack of structure in these documents.
segment.target: In XFA PDF documents in Adobe Reader, all elements are now rendered on separate lines. This change was made because large sections (sometimes even the entire document) were being rendered without breaks due to the general lack of structure in these documents.

segment.source: Fixed problems when moving focus to or away from editable text fields in XFA PDF documents in Adobe Reader.
segment.target: Fixed problems when moving focus to or away from editable text fields in XFA PDF documents in Adobe Reader.

segment.source: In XFA PDF documents in Adobe Reader, changes to the value of a focused combo box will now be reported.
segment.target: In XFA PDF documents in Adobe Reader, changes to the value of a focused combo box will now be reported.

segment.source: Owner-drawn Combo boxes such as the ones to choose colors in Outlook Express are now accessible with NVDA. (#1340)
segment.target: Owner-drawn Combo boxes such as the ones to choose colors in Outlook Express are now accessible with NVDA. (#1340)

segment.source: In languages which use a space as a digit group/thousands separator such as French and German, numbers from separate chunks of text are no longer pronounced as a single number. This was particularly problematic for table cells containing numbers. (#555)
segment.target: In languages which use a space as a digit group/thousands separator such as French and German, numbers from separate chunks of text are no longer pronounced as a single number. This was particularly problematic for table cells containing numbers. (#555)

segment.source: nodes with an ARIA role of description in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls now are classed as static text, not edit fields.
segment.target: nodes with an ARIA role of description in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls now are classed as static text, not edit fields.

segment.source: Fixed various issues when pressing tab while focus is on a document in browse mode (e.g. tab inappropriately moving to the address bar in Internet Explorer). (#720, #1367)
segment.target: Fixed various issues when pressing tab while focus is on a document in browse mode (e.g. tab inappropriately moving to the address bar in Internet Explorer). (#720, #1367)

segment.source: When entering lists while reading text, NVDA now says, for example, "list with 5 items" instead of "listwith 5 items". (#1515)
segment.target: When entering lists while reading text, NVDA now says, for example, "list with 5 items" instead of "listwith 5 items". (#1515)

segment.source: In input help mode, gestures are logged even if their scripts bypass input help such as the scroll braille display forward and back commands.
segment.target: In input help mode, gestures are logged even if their scripts bypass input help such as the scroll braille display forward and back commands.

segment.source: In input help mode, when a modifier is held down on the keyboard, NVDA no longer reports the modifier as if it is modifying itself; e.g. NVDA+NVDA.
segment.target: In input help mode, when a modifier is held down on the keyboard, NVDA no longer reports the modifier as if it is modifying itself; e.g. NVDA+NVDA.

segment.source: In Adobe Reader documents, pressing c or shift+c to navigate to a combo box now works.
segment.target: In Adobe Reader documents, pressing c or shift+c to navigate to a combo box now works.

segment.source: The selected state of selectable table rows is now reported the same way it is for list and tree view items.
segment.target: The selected state of selectable table rows is now reported the same way it is for list and tree view items.

segment.source: Controls in Firefox and other Gecko applications can now be activated while in browse mode even if their content has been floated off-screen. (#801)
segment.target: Controls in Firefox and other Gecko applications can now be activated while in browse mode even if their content has been floated off-screen. (#801)

segment.source: You can no longer show an NVDA settings dialog while a message dialog is being shown, as the settings dialog was frozen in this case. (#1451)
segment.target: You can no longer show an NVDA settings dialog while a message dialog is being shown, as the settings dialog was frozen in this case. (#1451)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, there is no longer a lag when holding down or rapidly pressing keys to move between or select cells.
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, there is no longer a lag when holding down or rapidly pressing keys to move between or select cells.

segment.source: Fixed intermittent crashes of the NVDA service which meant that NVDA stopped running on secure Windows screens.
segment.target: Fixed intermittent crashes of the NVDA service which meant that NVDA stopped running on secure Windows screens.

segment.source: Fixed problems that sometimes occurred with braille displays when a change caused text that was being displayed to disappear. (#1377)
segment.target: Fixed problems that sometimes occurred with braille displays when a change caused text that was being displayed to disappear. (#1377)

segment.source: The downloads window in Internet Explorer 9 can now be navigated and read with NVDA. (#1280)
segment.target: The downloads window in Internet Explorer 9 can now be navigated and read with NVDA. (#1280)

segment.source: It is no longer possible to accidentally start multiple copies of NVDA at the same time. (#507)
segment.target: It is no longer possible to accidentally start multiple copies of NVDA at the same time. (#507)

segment.source: On slow systems, NVDA no longer inappropriately causes its main window to be shown all the time while running. (#726)
segment.target: On slow systems, NVDA no longer inappropriately causes its main window to be shown all the time while running. (#726)

segment.source: NVDA no longer crashes on Windows xP when starting a WPF application. (#1437)
segment.target: NVDA no longer crashes on Windows xP when starting a WPF application. (#1437)

segment.source: Say all and say all with review are now able to work in UI automation text controls that support all required functionality. For example, you can now use say all with review on XPS Viewer documents.
segment.target: Say all and say all with review are now able to work in UI automation text controls that support all required functionality. For example, you can now use say all with review on XPS Viewer documents.

segment.source: NVDA no longer inappropriately classes some list items in the Outlook Express / Windows Live Mail message rules Apply Now dialog as being checkboxes. (#576)
segment.target: NVDA no longer inappropriately classes some list items in the Outlook Express / Windows Live Mail message rules Apply Now dialog as being checkboxes. (#576)

segment.source: Combo boxes are no longer reported as having a sub-menu.
segment.target: Combo boxes are no longer reported as having a sub-menu.

segment.source: NVDA is now able to read the recipiants in the To, CC and BCC fields in Microsoft Outlook. (#421)
segment.target: NVDA is now able to read the recipiants in the To, CC and BCC fields in Microsoft Outlook. (#421)

segment.source: Fixed the issue in NVDA's Voice Settings dialog where the value of sliders was sometimes not reported when changed. (#1411)
segment.target: Fixed the issue in NVDA's Voice Settings dialog where the value of sliders was sometimes not reported when changed. (#1411)

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to announce the new cell when moving in an Excel spreadsheet after cutting and pasting. (#1567)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to announce the new cell when moving in an Excel spreadsheet after cutting and pasting. (#1567)

segment.source: NVDA no longer becomes worse at guessing color names the more colors it announces.
segment.target: NVDA no longer becomes worse at guessing color names the more colors it announces.

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, fixed the inability to read parts of rare pages which contain iframes marked with an ARIA role of presentation. (#1569)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, fixed the inability to read parts of rare pages which contain iframes marked with an ARIA role of presentation. (#1569)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, fixed a rare problem where the focus kept bouncing infinitely between the document and a multi-line editable text field in focus mode. (#1566)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, fixed a rare problem where the focus kept bouncing infinitely between the document and a multi-line editable text field in focus mode. (#1566)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word 2010 NVDA will now automatically read confirmation dialogs. (#1538)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word 2010 NVDA will now automatically read confirmation dialogs. (#1538)

segment.source: In multi-line editable text fields in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, selection on lines after the first is now reported correctly. (#1590)
segment.target: In multi-line editable text fields in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, selection on lines after the first is now reported correctly. (#1590)

segment.source: Improved moving by word in many cases, including browse mode and Windows Edit controls. (#1580)
segment.target: Improved moving by word in many cases, including browse mode and Windows Edit controls. (#1580)

segment.source: The NVDA installer no longer shows garbled text for Hong Kong versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7. (#1596)
segment.target: The NVDA installer no longer shows garbled text for Hong Kong versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7. (#1596)

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to load the Microsoft Speech API version 5 synthesizer if the configuration contains settings for that synthesizer but is missing the voice setting. (#1599)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to load the Microsoft Speech API version 5 synthesizer if the configuration contains settings for that synthesizer but is missing the voice setting. (#1599)

segment.source: In editable text fields in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, NVDA no longer lags or freezes when braille is enabled.
segment.target: In editable text fields in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, NVDA no longer lags or freezes when braille is enabled.

segment.source: In firefox brows mode, NVDA no longer refuses to include content that is inside a focusable node with an ARIA role of presentation.
segment.target: In firefox brows mode, NVDA no longer refuses to include content that is inside a focusable node with an ARIA role of presentation.

segment.source: In Microsoft Word with braille enabled, lines on pages after the first page are now reported correctly. (#1603)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word with braille enabled, lines on pages after the first page are now reported correctly. (#1603)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word 2003, lines of right-to-left text can once again be read with braille enabled. (#627)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word 2003, lines of right-to-left text can once again be read with braille enabled. (#627)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word, say all now works correctly when the document does not end with a sentence ending.
segment.target: In Microsoft Word, say all now works correctly when the document does not end with a sentence ending.

segment.source: When opening a plain text message in Windows Live Mail 2011, NVDA will correctly focus on the message document allowing it to be read.
segment.target: When opening a plain text message in Windows Live Mail 2011, NVDA will correctly focus on the message document allowing it to be read.

segment.source: NVDA no longer temporarily freezes or refuses to speak when in the Move to / Copy to dialogs in Windows Live Mail. (#574)
segment.target: NVDA no longer temporarily freezes or refuses to speak when in the Move to / Copy to dialogs in Windows Live Mail. (#574)

segment.source: In Outlook 2010, NVDA will now correctly track the focus in the message list. (#1285)
segment.target: In Outlook 2010, NVDA will now correctly track the focus in the message list. (#1285)

segment.source: Some USB connection issues have been resolved with the MDV Lilli braille display. (#241)
segment.target: Some USB connection issues have been resolved with the MDV Lilli braille display. (#241)

segment.source: In Internet explorer and other MSHTML controls, spaces are no longer ignored in browse mode in certain cases (e.g. after a link).
segment.target: In Internet explorer and other MSHTML controls, spaces are no longer ignored in browse mode in certain cases (e.g. after a link).

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, some extraneous line breaks have been eliminated in browse mode. specifically, HTML elements with a display style of None no longer force a line break. (#1685)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, some extraneous line breaks have been eliminated in browse mode. specifically, HTML elements with a display style of None no longer force a line break. (#1685)

segment.source: If NVDA is unable to start, failure to play the Windows critical stop sound no longer clobbers the critical error message in the log file.
segment.target: If NVDA is unable to start, failure to play the Windows critical stop sound no longer clobbers the critical error message in the log file.

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: Developer documentation can now be generated using SCons. See readme.txt at the root of the source distribution for details, including associated dependencies.
segment.target: Developer documentation can now be generated using SCons. See readme.txt at the root of the source distribution for details, including associated dependencies.

segment.source: Locales can now provide descriptions for characters. See the Character Descriptions section of the Developer Guide for details. (#55)
segment.target: Locales can now provide descriptions for characters. See the Character Descriptions section of the Developer Guide for details. (#55)

segment.source: Locales can now provide information about the pronunciation of specific punctuation and other symbols. See the Symbol Pronunciation section of the Developer Guide for details. (#332)
segment.target: Locales can now provide information about the pronunciation of specific punctuation and other symbols. See the Symbol Pronunciation section of the Developer Guide for details. (#332)

segment.source: You can now build NVDAHelper with several debugging options using the nvdaHelperDebugFlags SCons variable. See readme.txt at the root of the source distribution for details. (#1390)
segment.target: You can now build NVDAHelper with several debugging options using the nvdaHelperDebugFlags SCons variable. See readme.txt at the root of the source distribution for details. (#1390)

segment.source: Synth drivers are now passed a sequence of text and speech commands to speak, instead of just text and an index.
segment.target: Synth drivers are now passed a sequence of text and speech commands to speak, instead of just text and an index.

segment.source: This allows for embedded indexes, parameter changes, etc.
segment.target: This allows for embedded indexes, parameter changes, etc.

segment.source: Drivers should implement SynthDriver.speak() instead of SynthDriver.speakText() and SynthDriver.speakCharacter().
segment.target: Drivers should implement SynthDriver.speak() instead of SynthDriver.speakText() and SynthDriver.speakCharacter().

segment.source: The old methods will be used if SynthDriver.speak() is not implemented, but they are deprecated and will be removed in a future release.
segment.target: The old methods will be used if SynthDriver.speak() is not implemented, but they are deprecated and will be removed in a future release.

segment.source: gui.execute() has been removed. wx.CallAfter() should be used instead.
segment.target: gui.execute() has been removed. wx.CallAfter() should be used instead.

segment.source: gui.scriptUI has been removed.
segment.target: gui.scriptUI has been removed.

segment.source: For message dialogs, use wx.CallAfter(gui.messageBox, ...).
segment.target: For message dialogs, use wx.CallAfter(gui.messageBox, ...).

segment.source: For all other dialogs, real wx dialogs should be used instead.
segment.target: For all other dialogs, real wx dialogs should be used instead.

segment.source: A new gui.runScriptModalDialog() function simplifies using modal dialogs from scripts.
segment.target: A new gui.runScriptModalDialog() function simplifies using modal dialogs from scripts.

segment.source: Synth drivers can now support boolean settings. See SynthDriverHandler.BooleanSynthSetting.
segment.target: Synth drivers can now support boolean settings. See SynthDriverHandler.BooleanSynthSetting.

segment.source: SCons now accepts a certTimestampServer variable specifying the URL of a timestamping server to use to timestamp authenticode signatures. (#1644)
segment.target: SCons now accepts a certTimestampServer variable specifying the URL of a timestamping server to use to timestamp authenticode signatures. (#1644)

segment.source: This release fixes several security and other important issues found in NVDA 2011.1.
segment.target: This release fixes several security and other important issues found in NVDA 2011.1.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: The Donate item in the NVDA menu is now disabled when running on the logon, lock, UAC and other secure Windows screens, as this is a security risk. (#1419)
segment.target: The Donate item in the NVDA menu is now disabled when running on the logon, lock, UAC and other secure Windows screens, as this is a security risk. (#1419)

segment.source: It is now impossible to copy or paste within NVDA's user interface while on secure desktops (lock screen, UAC screen and windows logon) as this is a security risk. (#1421)
segment.target: It is now impossible to copy or paste within NVDA's user interface while on secure desktops (lock screen, UAC screen and windows logon) as this is a security risk. (#1421)

segment.source: In Firefox 4, the move to containing virtual buffer command (NVDA+control+space) now works as it should to escape embedded objects such as Flash content. (#1429)
segment.target: In Firefox 4, the move to containing virtual buffer command (NVDA+control+space) now works as it should to escape embedded objects such as Flash content. (#1429)

segment.source: When speaking of command keys is enabled, shifted characters are no longer incorrectly spoken as command keys. (#1422)
segment.target: When speaking of command keys is enabled, shifted characters are no longer incorrectly spoken as command keys. (#1422)

segment.source: When speaking of command keys is enabled, pressing space with modifiers other than shift (such as control and alt) is now reported as a command key. (#1424)
segment.target: When speaking of command keys is enabled, pressing space with modifiers other than shift (such as control and alt) is now reported as a command key. (#1424)

segment.source: Logging is now completely disabled when running on the logon, lock, UAC and other secure Windows screens, as this is a security risk. (#1435)
segment.target: Logging is now completely disabled when running on the logon, lock, UAC and other secure Windows screens, as this is a security risk. (#1435)

segment.source: In input help mode, Gestures are now logged even if they are not bound to a script (in accordance with the user guide). (#1425)
segment.target: In input help mode, Gestures are now logged even if they are not bound to a script (in accordance with the user guide). (#1425)

segment.source: Highlights of this release include automatic reporting of new text output in mIRC, PuTTY, Tera Term and SecureCRT; support for global plugins; announcement of bullets and numbering in Microsoft Word; additional key bindings for braille displays, including keys to move to the next and previous line; support for several Baum, HumanWare and APH braille displays; and reporting of colors for some controls, including IBM Lotus Symphony text controls.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include automatic reporting of new text output in mIRC, PuTTY, Tera Term and SecureCRT; support for global plugins; announcement of bullets and numbering in Microsoft Word; additional key bindings for braille displays, including keys to move to the next and previous line; support for several Baum, HumanWare and APH braille displays; and reporting of colors for some controls, including IBM Lotus Symphony text controls.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: Colors can now be reported for some controls. Automatic announcement can be configured in the Document Formatting preferences dialog. It can also be reported on demand using the report text formatting command (NVDA+f).
segment.target: Colors can now be reported for some controls. Automatic announcement can be configured in the Document Formatting preferences dialog. It can also be reported on demand using the report text formatting command (NVDA+f).

segment.source: Initially, this is supported in standard IAccessible2 editable text controls (such as in Mozilla applications), RichEdit controls (such as in Wordpad) and IBM Lotus Symphony text controls.
segment.target: Initially, this is supported in standard IAccessible2 editable text controls (such as in Mozilla applications), RichEdit controls (such as in Wordpad) and IBM Lotus Symphony text controls.

segment.source: In virtual buffers, you can now select by page (using shift+pageDown and shift+pageUp) and paragraph (using shift+control+downArrow and shift+control+upArrow). (#639)
segment.target: In virtual buffers, you can now select by page (using shift+pageDown and shift+pageUp) and paragraph (using shift+control+downArrow and shift+control+upArrow). (#639)

segment.source: NVDA now automatically reports new text output in mIRC, PuTTY, Tera Term and SecureCRT. (#936)
segment.target: NVDA now automatically reports new text output in mIRC, PuTTY, Tera Term and SecureCRT. (#936)

segment.source: Users can now add new key bindings or override existing ones for any script in NVDA by providing a single user input gesture map. (#194)
segment.target: Users can now add new key bindings or override existing ones for any script in NVDA by providing a single user input gesture map. (#194)

segment.source: Support for global plugins. Global plugins can add new functionality to NVDA which works across all applications. (#281)
segment.target: Support for global plugins. Global plugins can add new functionality to NVDA which works across all applications. (#281)

segment.source: A small beep is now heard when typing characters with the shift key while capslock is on. This can be turned off by unchecking the related new option in the Keyboard settings dialog. (#663)
segment.target: A small beep is now heard when typing characters with the shift key while capslock is on. This can be turned off by unchecking the related new option in the Keyboard settings dialog. (#663)

segment.source: hard page breaks are now announced when moving by line in Microsoft Word. (#758)
segment.target: hard page breaks are now announced when moving by line in Microsoft Word. (#758)

segment.source: Bullets and numbering are now spoken in Microsoft Word when moving by line. (#208)
segment.target: Bullets and numbering are now spoken in Microsoft Word when moving by line. (#208)

segment.source: A command to toggle Sleep mode for the current application (NVDA+shift+s) is now available. Sleep mode (previously known as self voicing mode) disables all screen reading functionality in NVDA for a particular application. Very useful for applications that provide their own speech and or screen reading features. Press this command again to disable Sleep mode.
segment.target: A command to toggle Sleep mode for the current application (NVDA+shift+s) is now available. Sleep mode (previously known as self voicing mode) disables all screen reading functionality in NVDA for a particular application. Very useful for applications that provide their own speech and or screen reading features. Press this command again to disable Sleep mode.

segment.source: Some additional braille display key bindings have been added. See the Supported Braille Displays section of the User Guide for details. (#209)
segment.target: Some additional braille display key bindings have been added. See the Supported Braille Displays section of the User Guide for details. (#209)

segment.source: For the convenience of third party developers, app modules as well as global plugins can now be reloaded without restarting NVDA. Use tools -> Reload plugins in the NVDA menu or NVDA+control+f3. (#544)
segment.target: For the convenience of third party developers, app modules as well as global plugins can now be reloaded without restarting NVDA. Use tools -> Reload plugins in the NVDA menu or NVDA+control+f3. (#544)

segment.source: NVDA now remembers the position you were at when returning to a previously visited web page. This applies until either the browser or NVDA is exited. (#132)
segment.target: NVDA now remembers the position you were at when returning to a previously visited web page. This applies until either the browser or NVDA is exited. (#132)

segment.source: Handy Tech braille displays can now be used without installing the Handy Tech universal driver. (#854)
segment.target: Handy Tech braille displays can now be used without installing the Handy Tech universal driver. (#854)

segment.source: Support for several Baum, HumanWare and APH braille displays. (#937)
segment.target: Support for several Baum, HumanWare and APH braille displays. (#937)

segment.source: The status bar in Media Player Classic Home Cinema is now recognised.
segment.target: The status bar in Media Player Classic Home Cinema is now recognised.

segment.source: The Freedom Scientific Focus 40 Blue braille display can now be used when connected via bluetooth. (#1345)
segment.target: The Freedom Scientific Focus 40 Blue braille display can now be used when connected via bluetooth. (#1345)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: Position information is no longer reported by default in some cases where it was usually incorrect; e.g. most menus, the Running Applications bar, the Notification Area, etc. However, this can be turned on again by an added option in the Object Presentation settings dialog.
segment.target: Position information is no longer reported by default in some cases where it was usually incorrect; e.g. most menus, the Running Applications bar, the Notification Area, etc. However, this can be turned on again by an added option in the Object Presentation settings dialog.

segment.source: Keyboard help has been renamed to input help to reflect that it handles input from sources other than the keyboard.
segment.target: Keyboard help has been renamed to input help to reflect that it handles input from sources other than the keyboard.

segment.source: Input Help no longer reports a script's code location via speech and braille as it is cryptic and irrelevant to the user. However, it is now logged for developers and advanced users.
segment.target: Input Help no longer reports a script's code location via speech and braille as it is cryptic and irrelevant to the user. However, it is now logged for developers and advanced users.

segment.source: When NVDA detects that it has frozen, it continues to intercept NVDA modifier keys, even though it passes all other keys through to the system. This prevents the user from unintentionally toggling caps lock, etc. if they press an NVDA modifier key without realising NVDA has frozen. (#939)
segment.target: When NVDA detects that it has frozen, it continues to intercept NVDA modifier keys, even though it passes all other keys through to the system. This prevents the user from unintentionally toggling caps lock, etc. if they press an NVDA modifier key without realising NVDA has frozen. (#939)

segment.source: If keys are held down after using the pass next key through command, all keys (including key repeats) are now passed through until the last key is released.
segment.target: If keys are held down after using the pass next key through command, all keys (including key repeats) are now passed through until the last key is released.

segment.source: If an NVDA modifier key is pressed twice in quick succession to pass it through and the second press is held down, all key repeats will now be passed through as well.
segment.target: If an NVDA modifier key is pressed twice in quick succession to pass it through and the second press is held down, all key repeats will now be passed through as well.

segment.source: The volume up, down and mute keys are now reported in input help. This could be helpful if the user is uncertain as to what these keys are.
segment.target: The volume up, down and mute keys are now reported in input help. This could be helpful if the user is uncertain as to what these keys are.

segment.source: The hotkey for the Review Cursor item in the NVDA Preferences menu has been changed from r to c to eliminate the conflict with the Braille Settings item.
segment.target: The hotkey for the Review Cursor item in the NVDA Preferences menu has been changed from r to c to eliminate the conflict with the Braille Settings item.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: When adding a new speech dictionary entry, the title of the dialog is now "Add dictionary entry" instead of "Edit dictionary entry". (#924)
segment.target: When adding a new speech dictionary entry, the title of the dialog is now "Add dictionary entry" instead of "Edit dictionary entry". (#924)

segment.source: In speech dictionary dialogs, the content of the Regular expression and Case sensitive columns of the Dictionary entries list is now presented in the configured NVDA language instead of always in English.
