segment.target: In speech dictionary dialogs, the content of the Regular expression and Case sensitive columns of the Dictionary entries list is now presented in the configured NVDA language instead of always in English.

segment.source: In AIM, position information is now announced in tree views.
segment.target: In AIM, position information is now announced in tree views.

segment.source: On sliders in the Voice Settings dialog, up arrow/page up/home now increase the setting and down arrow/page down/end decrease it. Previously, the opposite occurred, which is not logical and is inconsistent with the synth settings ring. (#221)
segment.target: On sliders in the Voice Settings dialog, up arrow/page up/home now increase the setting and down arrow/page down/end decrease it. Previously, the opposite occurred, which is not logical and is inconsistent with the synth settings ring. (#221)

segment.source: In virtual buffers with screen layout disabled, some extraneous blank lines no longer appear.
segment.target: In virtual buffers with screen layout disabled, some extraneous blank lines no longer appear.

segment.source: If an NVDA modifier key is pressed twice quickly but there is an intervening key press, the NVDA modifier key is no longer passed through on the second press.
segment.target: If an NVDA modifier key is pressed twice quickly but there is an intervening key press, the NVDA modifier key is no longer passed through on the second press.

segment.source: Punctuation keys are now spoken in input help even when speaking of punctuation is disabled. (#977)
segment.target: Punctuation keys are now spoken in input help even when speaking of punctuation is disabled. (#977)

segment.source: In the Keyboard Settings dialog, the keyboard layout names are now presented in the configured NVDA language instead of always in English. (#558)
segment.target: In the Keyboard Settings dialog, the keyboard layout names are now presented in the configured NVDA language instead of always in English. (#558)

segment.source: Fixed an issue where some items were rendered as empty in Adobe Reader documents; e.g. the links in the table of contents of the Apple iPhone IOS 4.1 User Guide.
segment.target: Fixed an issue where some items were rendered as empty in Adobe Reader documents; e.g. the links in the table of contents of the Apple iPhone IOS 4.1 User Guide.

segment.source: The "Use currently saved settings on the logon and other secure screens" button in NVDA's General Settings dialog now works if used immediately after NVDA is newly installed but before a secure screen has appeared. Previously, NVDA reported that copying was successful, but it actually had no effect. (#1194)
segment.target: The "Use currently saved settings on the logon and other secure screens" button in NVDA's General Settings dialog now works if used immediately after NVDA is newly installed but before a secure screen has appeared. Previously, NVDA reported that copying was successful, but it actually had no effect. (#1194)

segment.source: It is no longer possible to have two NVDA settings dialogs open simultaneously. This fixes issues where one open dialog depends on another open dialog; e.g. changing the synthesiser while the Voice Settings dialog is open. (#603)
segment.target: It is no longer possible to have two NVDA settings dialogs open simultaneously. This fixes issues where one open dialog depends on another open dialog; e.g. changing the synthesiser while the Voice Settings dialog is open. (#603)

segment.source: On systems with UAC enabled, the "Use currently saved settings on the logon and other secure screens" button in NVDA's General Settings dialog no longer fails after the UAC prompt if the user's account name contains a space. (#918)
segment.target: On systems with UAC enabled, the "Use currently saved settings on the logon and other secure screens" button in NVDA's General Settings dialog no longer fails after the UAC prompt if the user's account name contains a space. (#918)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, NVDA now uses the URL as a last resort to determine the name of a link, rather than presenting empty links. (#633)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, NVDA now uses the URL as a last resort to determine the name of a link, rather than presenting empty links. (#633)

segment.source: NVDA no longer ignores the focus in AOL Instant Messenger 7 menus. (#655)
segment.target: NVDA no longer ignores the focus in AOL Instant Messenger 7 menus. (#655)

segment.source: Announce the correct label for errors in the Microsoft Word Spell Check dialog (e.g. Not in dictionary, Grammar error, punctuation). Previously they were all announced as grammar error. (#883)
segment.target: Announce the correct label for errors in the Microsoft Word Spell Check dialog (e.g. Not in dictionary, Grammar error, punctuation). Previously they were all announced as grammar error. (#883)

segment.source: Typing in Microsoft Word while using a braille display should no longer cause garbled text to be typed, and a rare freeze when pressing a braille routing key in Word documents has been fixed. (#1212) However a limitation is that Arabic text can no longer be read in Word 2003 and below, while using a braille display. (#627)
segment.target: Typing in Microsoft Word while using a braille display should no longer cause garbled text to be typed, and a rare freeze when pressing a braille routing key in Word documents has been fixed. (#1212) However a limitation is that Arabic text can no longer be read in Word 2003 and below, while using a braille display. (#627)

segment.source: When pressing the delete key in an edit field, the text/cursor on a braille display should now always be updated appropriately to reflect the change. (#947)
segment.target: When pressing the delete key in an edit field, the text/cursor on a braille display should now always be updated appropriately to reflect the change. (#947)

segment.source: Changes on dynamic pages in Gecko2 documents (E.g. Firefox 4) while multiple tabs are open are now properly reflected by NVDA. Previously only changes in the first tab were reflected. (Mozilla bug 610985)
segment.target: Changes on dynamic pages in Gecko2 documents (E.g. Firefox 4) while multiple tabs are open are now properly reflected by NVDA. Previously only changes in the first tab were reflected. (Mozilla bug 610985)

segment.source: NVDA can now properly announce the suggestions for grammar and punctuation errors in Microsoft Word spell check dialog. (#704)
segment.target: NVDA can now properly announce the suggestions for grammar and punctuation errors in Microsoft Word spell check dialog. (#704)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, NVDA no longer presents destination anchors as empty links in its virtual buffer. Instead, these anchors are hidden as they should be. (#1326)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, NVDA no longer presents destination anchors as empty links in its virtual buffer. Instead, these anchors are hidden as they should be. (#1326)

segment.source: Object navigation around and within standard groupbox windows is no longer broken and asymmetrical.
segment.target: Object navigation around and within standard groupbox windows is no longer broken and asymmetrical.

segment.source: In Firefox and other Gecko-based controls, NVDA will no longer get stuck in a subframe if it finishes loading before the outer document.
segment.target: In Firefox and other Gecko-based controls, NVDA will no longer get stuck in a subframe if it finishes loading before the outer document.

segment.source: NVDA now appropriately announces the next character when deleting a character with numpadDelete. (#286)
segment.target: NVDA now appropriately announces the next character when deleting a character with numpadDelete. (#286)

segment.source: On the Windows XP logon screen, the user name is once again reported when the selected user is changed.
segment.target: On the Windows XP logon screen, the user name is once again reported when the selected user is changed.

segment.source: Fixed problems when reading text in Windows command consoles with reporting of line numbers enabled.
segment.target: Fixed problems when reading text in Windows command consoles with reporting of line numbers enabled.

segment.source: The Elements List dialog for virtual buffers is now usable by sighted users. All controls are visible on screen. (#1321)
segment.target: The Elements List dialog for virtual buffers is now usable by sighted users. All controls are visible on screen. (#1321)

segment.source: The list of entries in the Speech Dictionary dialog is now more readable by sighted users. The list is now large enough to show all of its columns on screen. (#90)
segment.target: The list of entries in the Speech Dictionary dialog is now more readable by sighted users. The list is now large enough to show all of its columns on screen. (#90)

segment.source: On ALVA BC640/BC680 braille displays, NVDA no longer disregards display keys that are still held down after another key is released.
segment.target: On ALVA BC640/BC680 braille displays, NVDA no longer disregards display keys that are still held down after another key is released.

segment.source: Adobe Reader X no longer crashes after leaving the untagged document options before the processing dialog appears. (#1218)
segment.target: Adobe Reader X no longer crashes after leaving the untagged document options before the processing dialog appears. (#1218)

segment.source: NVDA now switches to the appropriate braille display driver when you revert to saved configuration. (#1346)
segment.target: NVDA now switches to the appropriate braille display driver when you revert to saved configuration. (#1346)

segment.source: The Visual Studio 2008 Project Wizard is read correctly again. (#974)
segment.target: The Visual Studio 2008 Project Wizard is read correctly again. (#974)

segment.source: NVDA no longer completely fails to work in applications which contain non-ASCII characters in their executable name. (#1352)
segment.target: NVDA no longer completely fails to work in applications which contain non-ASCII characters in their executable name. (#1352)

segment.source: When reading by line in AkelPad with word wrap enabled, NVDA no longer reads the first character of the following line at the end of the current line.
segment.target: When reading by line in AkelPad with word wrap enabled, NVDA no longer reads the first character of the following line at the end of the current line.

segment.source: In the Visual Studio 2005/2008 code editor, NVDA no longer reads the entire text after every typed character. (#975)
segment.target: In the Visual Studio 2005/2008 code editor, NVDA no longer reads the entire text after every typed character. (#975)

segment.source: Fixed the issue where some braille displays weren't cleared properly when NVDA was exited or the display was changed.
segment.target: Fixed the issue where some braille displays weren't cleared properly when NVDA was exited or the display was changed.

segment.source: The initial focus is no longer sometimes spoken twice when NVDA starts. (#1359)
segment.target: The initial focus is no longer sometimes spoken twice when NVDA starts. (#1359)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: SCons is now used to prepare the source tree and create binary builds, portable archives, installers, etc. See readme.txt at the root of the source distribution for details.
segment.target: SCons is now used to prepare the source tree and create binary builds, portable archives, installers, etc. See readme.txt at the root of the source distribution for details.

segment.source: The key names used by NVDA (including key maps) have been made more friendly/logical; e.g. upArrow instead of extendedUp and numpadPageUp instead of prior. See the vkCodes module for a list.
segment.target: The key names used by NVDA (including key maps) have been made more friendly/logical; e.g. upArrow instead of extendedUp and numpadPageUp instead of prior. See the vkCodes module for a list.

segment.source: All input from the user is now represented by an inputCore.InputGesture instance. (#601)
segment.target: All input from the user is now represented by an inputCore.InputGesture instance. (#601)

segment.source: Each source of input subclasses the base InputGesture class.
segment.target: Each source of input subclasses the base InputGesture class.

segment.source: Key presses on the system keyboard are encompassed by the keyboardHandler.KeyboardInputGesture class.
segment.target: Key presses on the system keyboard are encompassed by the keyboardHandler.KeyboardInputGesture class.

segment.source: Presses of buttons, wheels and other controls on a braille display are encompassed by subclasses of the braille.BrailleDisplayGesture class. These subclasses are provided by each braille display driver.
segment.target: Presses of buttons, wheels and other controls on a braille display are encompassed by subclasses of the braille.BrailleDisplayGesture class. These subclasses are provided by each braille display driver.

segment.source: Input gestures are bound to ScriptableObjects using the ScriptableObject.bindGesture() method on an instance or an __gestures dict on the class which maps gesture identifiers to script names. See baseObject.ScriptableObject for details.
segment.target: Input gestures are bound to ScriptableObjects using the ScriptableObject.bindGesture() method on an instance or an __gestures dict on the class which maps gesture identifiers to script names. See baseObject.ScriptableObject for details.

segment.source: App modules no longer have key map files. All input gesture bindings must be done in the app module itself.
segment.target: App modules no longer have key map files. All input gesture bindings must be done in the app module itself.

segment.source: All scripts now take an InputGesture instance instead of a key press.
segment.target: All scripts now take an InputGesture instance instead of a key press.

segment.source: KeyboardInputGestures can be sent on to the OS using the send() method of the gesture.
segment.target: KeyboardInputGestures can be sent on to the OS using the send() method of the gesture.

segment.source: To send an arbitrary key press, you must now create a KeyboardInputGesture using KeyboardInputGesture.fromName() and then use its send() method.
segment.target: To send an arbitrary key press, you must now create a KeyboardInputGesture using KeyboardInputGesture.fromName() and then use its send() method.

segment.source: Locales may now provide an input gesture map file to add new bindings or override existing bindings for scripts anywhere in NVDA. (#810)
segment.target: Locales may now provide an input gesture map file to add new bindings or override existing bindings for scripts anywhere in NVDA. (#810)

segment.source: Locale gesture maps should be placed in locale\LANG\gestures.ini, where LANG is the language code.
segment.target: Locale gesture maps should be placed in locale\LANG\gestures.ini, where LANG is the language code.

segment.source: See inputCore.GlobalGestureMap for details of the file format.
segment.target: See inputCore.GlobalGestureMap for details of the file format.

segment.source: The new LiveText and Terminal NVDAObject behaviors facilitate automatic reporting of new text. See those classes in NVDAObjects.behaviors for details. (#936)
segment.target: The new LiveText and Terminal NVDAObject behaviors facilitate automatic reporting of new text. See those classes in NVDAObjects.behaviors for details. (#936)

segment.source: The NVDAObjects.window.DisplayModelLiveText overlay class can be used for objects which must retrieve text written to the display.
segment.target: The NVDAObjects.window.DisplayModelLiveText overlay class can be used for objects which must retrieve text written to the display.

segment.source: See the mirc and putty app modules for usage examples.
segment.target: See the mirc and putty app modules for usage examples.

segment.source: There is no longer an _default app module. App modules should instead subclass appModuleHandler.AppModule (the base AppModule class).
segment.target: There is no longer an _default app module. App modules should instead subclass appModuleHandler.AppModule (the base AppModule class).

segment.source: Support for global plugins which can globally bind scripts, handle NVDAObject events and choose NVDAObject overlay classes. (#281) See globalPluginHandler.GlobalPlugin for details.
segment.target: Support for global plugins which can globally bind scripts, handle NVDAObject events and choose NVDAObject overlay classes. (#281) See globalPluginHandler.GlobalPlugin for details.

segment.source: On SynthDriver objects, the available* attributes for string settings (e.g. availableVoices and availableVariants) are now OrderedDicts keyed by ID instead of lists.
segment.target: On SynthDriver objects, the available* attributes for string settings (e.g. availableVoices and availableVariants) are now OrderedDicts keyed by ID instead of lists.

segment.source: synthDriverHandler.VoiceInfo now takes an optional language argument which specifies the language of the voice.
segment.target: synthDriverHandler.VoiceInfo now takes an optional language argument which specifies the language of the voice.

segment.source: SynthDriver objects now provide a language attribute which specifies the language of the current voice.
segment.target: SynthDriver objects now provide a language attribute which specifies the language of the current voice.

segment.source: The base implementation uses the language specified on the VoiceInfo objects in availableVoices. This is suitable for most synthesisers which support one language per voice.
segment.target: The base implementation uses the language specified on the VoiceInfo objects in availableVoices. This is suitable for most synthesisers which support one language per voice.

segment.source: Braille display drivers have been enhanced to allow buttons, wheels and other controls to be bound to NVDA scripts:
segment.target: Braille display drivers have been enhanced to allow buttons, wheels and other controls to be bound to NVDA scripts:

segment.source: Drivers can provide a global input gesture map to add bindings for scripts anywhere in NVDA.
segment.target: Drivers can provide a global input gesture map to add bindings for scripts anywhere in NVDA.

segment.source: They can also provide their own scripts to perform display specific functions.
segment.target: They can also provide their own scripts to perform display specific functions.

segment.source: See braille.BrailleDisplayDriver for details and existing braille display drivers for examples.
segment.target: See braille.BrailleDisplayDriver for details and existing braille display drivers for examples.

segment.source: The 'selfVoicing' property on AppModule classes has now been renamed to 'sleepMode'.
segment.target: The 'selfVoicing' property on AppModule classes has now been renamed to 'sleepMode'.

segment.source: The app module events event_appLoseFocus and event_appGainFocus have now been renamed to event_appModule_loseFocus and event_appModule_gainFocus, respectivly, in order to make the naming convention consistent with app modules and tree interceptors.
segment.target: The app module events event_appLoseFocus and event_appGainFocus have now been renamed to event_appModule_loseFocus and event_appModule_gainFocus, respectivly, in order to make the naming convention consistent with app modules and tree interceptors.

segment.source: All braille display drivers should now use braille.BrailleDisplayDriver instead of braille.BrailleDisplayDriverWithCursor.
segment.target: All braille display drivers should now use braille.BrailleDisplayDriver instead of braille.BrailleDisplayDriverWithCursor.

segment.source: The cursor is now managed outside of the driver.
segment.target: The cursor is now managed outside of the driver.

segment.source: Existing drivers need only change their class statement accordingly and rename their _display method to display.
segment.target: Existing drivers need only change their class statement accordingly and rename their _display method to display.

segment.source: Notable features of this release include greatly simplified object navigation; virtual buffers for Adobe Flash content; access to many previously inaccessible controls by retrieving text written to the screen; flat review of screen text; support for IBM Lotus Symphony documents; reporting of table row and column headers in Mozilla Firefox; and significantly improved user documentation.
segment.target: Notable features of this release include greatly simplified object navigation; virtual buffers for Adobe Flash content; access to many previously inaccessible controls by retrieving text written to the screen; flat review of screen text; support for IBM Lotus Symphony documents; reporting of table row and column headers in Mozilla Firefox; and significantly improved user documentation.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: Navigating through objects with the review cursor has been greatly simplified. The review cursor now excludes objects which aren't useful to the user; i.e. objects only used for layout purposes and unavailable objects.
segment.target: Navigating through objects with the review cursor has been greatly simplified. The review cursor now excludes objects which aren't useful to the user; i.e. objects only used for layout purposes and unavailable objects.

segment.source: In applications using the Java Access Bridge (including OpenOffice.org), formatting can now be reported in text controls. (#358, #463)
segment.target: In applications using the Java Access Bridge (including OpenOffice.org), formatting can now be reported in text controls. (#358, #463)

segment.source: When moving the mouse over cells in Microsoft Excel, NVDA will appropriately announce them.
segment.target: When moving the mouse over cells in Microsoft Excel, NVDA will appropriately announce them.

segment.source: In applications using the Java Access Bridge, the text of a dialog is now reported when the dialog appears. (#554)
segment.target: In applications using the Java Access Bridge, the text of a dialog is now reported when the dialog appears. (#554)

segment.source: A virtualBuffer can now be used to navigate adobe Flash content. Object navigation and interacting with the controls directly (by turning on focus mode) is still supported. (#453)
segment.target: A virtualBuffer can now be used to navigate adobe Flash content. Object navigation and interacting with the controls directly (by turning on focus mode) is still supported. (#453)

segment.source: Editable text controls in the Eclipse IDE, including the code editor, are now accessible. You must be using Eclipse 3.6 or later. (#256, #641)
segment.target: Editable text controls in the Eclipse IDE, including the code editor, are now accessible. You must be using Eclipse 3.6 or later. (#256, #641)

segment.source: NVDA can now retrieve most text written to the screen. (#40, #643)
segment.target: NVDA can now retrieve most text written to the screen. (#40, #643)

segment.source: This allows for reading of controls which do not expose information in more direct/reliable ways.
segment.target: This allows for reading of controls which do not expose information in more direct/reliable ways.

segment.source: Controls made accessible by this feature include: some menu items which display icons (e.g. the Open With menu on files in Windows XP) (#151), editable text fields in Windows Live applications (#200), the errors list in Outlook Express (#582), the editable text control in TextPad (#605), lists in Eudora, many controls in Australian E-tax and the formula bar in Microsoft Excel.
segment.target: Controls made accessible by this feature include: some menu items which display icons (e.g. the Open With menu on files in Windows XP) (#151), editable text fields in Windows Live applications (#200), the errors list in Outlook Express (#582), the editable text control in TextPad (#605), lists in Eudora, many controls in Australian E-tax and the formula bar in Microsoft Excel.

segment.source: Support for the code editor in Microsoft Visual Studio 2005 and 2008. At least Visual Studio Standard is required; this does not work in the Express editions. (#457)
segment.target: Support for the code editor in Microsoft Visual Studio 2005 and 2008. At least Visual Studio Standard is required; this does not work in the Express editions. (#457)

segment.source: Support for IBM Lotus Symphony documents.
segment.target: Support for IBM Lotus Symphony documents.

segment.source: Early experimental support for Google Chrome. Please note that Chrome's screen reader support is far from complete and additional work may also be required in NVDA. You will need a recent development build of Chrome to try this.
segment.target: Early experimental support for Google Chrome. Please note that Chrome's screen reader support is far from complete and additional work may also be required in NVDA. You will need a recent development build of Chrome to try this.

segment.source: The state of toggle keys (caps lock, num lock and scroll lock) is now displayed in braille when they are pressed. (#620)
segment.target: The state of toggle keys (caps lock, num lock and scroll lock) is now displayed in braille when they are pressed. (#620)

segment.source: Help balloons are now displayed in braille when they appear. (#652)
segment.target: Help balloons are now displayed in braille when they appear. (#652)

segment.source: Added a driver for the MDV Lilli braille display. (#241)
segment.target: Added a driver for the MDV Lilli braille display. (#241)

segment.source: When selecting an entire row or column in Microsoft Excel with the shortcut keys shift+space and control+space, the new selection is now reported. (#759)
segment.target: When selecting an entire row or column in Microsoft Excel with the shortcut keys shift+space and control+space, the new selection is now reported. (#759)

segment.source: Table row and column headers can now be reported. This is configurable from the Document Formatting preferences dialog.
segment.target: Table row and column headers can now be reported. This is configurable from the Document Formatting preferences dialog.

segment.source: Currently, this is supported in documents in Mozilla applications such as Firefox (version 3.6.11 and later) and Thunderbird (version 3.1.5 and later). (#361)
segment.target: Currently, this is supported in documents in Mozilla applications such as Firefox (version 3.6.11 and later) and Thunderbird (version 3.1.5 and later). (#361)

segment.source: Introduced commands for flat review: (#58)
segment.target: Introduced commands for flat review: (#58)

segment.source: NVDA+numpad7 switches to flat review, placing the review cursor at the position of the current object, allowing you to review the screen (or a document if within one) with the text review commands.
segment.target: NVDA+numpad7 switches to flat review, placing the review cursor at the position of the current object, allowing you to review the screen (or a document if within one) with the text review commands.

segment.source: NVDA+numpad1 moves the review cursor into the object represented by the text at the position of the review cursor, allowing you to navigate by object from that point.
segment.target: NVDA+numpad1 moves the review cursor into the object represented by the text at the position of the review cursor, allowing you to navigate by object from that point.

segment.source: Current NVDA user settings can be copied to be used on secure Windows screens such as the logon and UAC screens by pressing a button in the General Settings dialog. (#730)
segment.target: Current NVDA user settings can be copied to be used on secure Windows screens such as the logon and UAC screens by pressing a button in the General Settings dialog. (#730)

segment.source: Support for Mozilla Firefox 4.
segment.target: Support for Mozilla Firefox 4.

segment.source: Support for Microsoft Internet Explorer 9.
segment.target: Support for Microsoft Internet Explorer 9.

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: The sayAll by Navigator object (NVDA+numpadAdd), navigator object next in flow (NVDA+shift+numpad6) and navigator object previous in flow (NVDA+shift+numpad4) commands have been removed for the time being, due to bugginess and to free up the keys for other possible features.
segment.target: The sayAll by Navigator object (NVDA+numpadAdd), navigator object next in flow (NVDA+shift+numpad6) and navigator object previous in flow (NVDA+shift+numpad4) commands have been removed for the time being, due to bugginess and to free up the keys for other possible features.

segment.source: In the NVDA Synthesizer dialog, only the display name of the synthesizer is now listed. Previously, it was prefixed by the driver's name, which is only relevant internally.
segment.target: In the NVDA Synthesizer dialog, only the display name of the synthesizer is now listed. Previously, it was prefixed by the driver's name, which is only relevant internally.

segment.source: When in embedded applications or virtual buffers inside another virtualBuffer (e.g. Flash), you can now press nvda+control+space to move out of the embedded application or virtual buffer to the containing document. Previously nvda+space was used for this. Now nvda+space is specifically only for toggling brows/focus modes on virtualBuffers.
segment.target: When in embedded applications or virtual buffers inside another virtualBuffer (e.g. Flash), you can now press nvda+control+space to move out of the embedded application or virtual buffer to the containing document. Previously nvda+space was used for this. Now nvda+space is specifically only for toggling brows/focus modes on virtualBuffers.

segment.source: If the speech viewer (enabled under the tools menu) is given the focus (e.g. it was clicked in) new text will not appear in the control until focus is moved away. This allows for selecting the text with greater ease (e.g. for copying).
segment.target: If the speech viewer (enabled under the tools menu) is given the focus (e.g. it was clicked in) new text will not appear in the control until focus is moved away. This allows for selecting the text with greater ease (e.g. for copying).

segment.source: The Log Viewer and Python Console are maximised when activated.
segment.target: The Log Viewer and Python Console are maximised when activated.

segment.source: When focusing on a worksheet in Microsoft Excel and there is more than one cell selected, the selection range is announced, rather than just the active cell. (#763)
segment.target: When focusing on a worksheet in Microsoft Excel and there is more than one cell selected, the selection range is announced, rather than just the active cell. (#763)

segment.source: Saving configuration and changing of particular sensitive options is now disabled when running on the logon, UAC and other secure Windows screens.
segment.target: Saving configuration and changing of particular sensitive options is now disabled when running on the logon, UAC and other secure Windows screens.

segment.source: Updated eSpeak speech synthesiser to 1.44.03.
segment.target: Updated eSpeak speech synthesiser to 1.44.03.

segment.source: If NVDA is already running, activating the NVDA shortcut on the desktop (which includes pressing control+alt+n) will restart NVDA.
segment.target: If NVDA is already running, activating the NVDA shortcut on the desktop (which includes pressing control+alt+n) will restart NVDA.

segment.source: Removed the report text under the mouse checkbox from the Mouse settings dialog and replaced it with an Enable mouse tracking checkbox, which better matches the toggle mouse tracking script (NVDA+m).
segment.target: Removed the report text under the mouse checkbox from the Mouse settings dialog and replaced it with an Enable mouse tracking checkbox, which better matches the toggle mouse tracking script (NVDA+m).

segment.source: Updates to the laptop keyboard layout so that it includes all commands available in the desktop layout and works correctly on non-English keyboards. (#798, #800)
segment.target: Updates to the laptop keyboard layout so that it includes all commands available in the desktop layout and works correctly on non-English keyboards. (#798, #800)

segment.source: Significant improvements and updates to the user documentation, including documentation of the laptop keyboard commands and synchronisation of the Keyboard Commands Quick Reference with the User Guide. (#455)
segment.target: Significant improvements and updates to the user documentation, including documentation of the laptop keyboard commands and synchronisation of the Keyboard Commands Quick Reference with the User Guide. (#455)

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.1.1. Notably, this fixes some issues related to Chinese braille as well as characters which are undefined in the translation table. (#484, #499)
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.1.1. Notably, this fixes some issues related to Chinese braille as well as characters which are undefined in the translation table. (#484, #499)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: In Torrent, the focused item in the torrents list no longer reports repeatedly or steals focus when a menu is open.
segment.target: In Torrent, the focused item in the torrents list no longer reports repeatedly or steals focus when a menu is open.

segment.source: In Torrent, the names of the files in the Torrent Contents list are now reported.
segment.target: In Torrent, the names of the files in the Torrent Contents list are now reported.

segment.source: In Mozilla applications, focus is now correctly detected when it lands on an empty table or tree.
segment.target: In Mozilla applications, focus is now correctly detected when it lands on an empty table or tree.

segment.source: In Mozilla applications, "not checked" is now correctly reported for checkable controls such as checkable table cells. (#571)
segment.target: In Mozilla applications, "not checked" is now correctly reported for checkable controls such as checkable table cells. (#571)

segment.source: In Mozilla applications, the text of correctly implemented ARIA dialogs is no longer ignored and will now be reported when the dialog appears. (#630)
segment.target: In Mozilla applications, the text of correctly implemented ARIA dialogs is no longer ignored and will now be reported when the dialog appears. (#630)

segment.source: in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, the ARIA level attribute is now honoured correctly.
segment.target: in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, the ARIA level attribute is now honoured correctly.

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, the ARIA role is now chosen over other type information to give a much more correct and predictable ARIA experience.
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, the ARIA role is now chosen over other type information to give a much more correct and predictable ARIA experience.

segment.source: Stopped a rare crash in Internet Explorer when navigating through frames or iFrames.
segment.target: Stopped a rare crash in Internet Explorer when navigating through frames or iFrames.

segment.source: In Microsoft Word documents, right-to-left lines (such as Arabic text) can be read again. (#627)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word documents, right-to-left lines (such as Arabic text) can be read again. (#627)

segment.source: Greatly reduced lag when large amounts of text are displayed in a Windows command console on 64-bit systems. (#622)
segment.target: Greatly reduced lag when large amounts of text are displayed in a Windows command console on 64-bit systems. (#622)

segment.source: If Skype is already started when NVDA starts, it is no longer necessary to restart Skype to enable accessibility. This may also be true for other applications which check the system screen reader flag.
segment.target: If Skype is already started when NVDA starts, it is no longer necessary to restart Skype to enable accessibility. This may also be true for other applications which check the system screen reader flag.

segment.source: In Microsoft Office applications, NVDA no longer crashes when speak foreground (NVDA+b) is pressed or when navigating some objects on toolbars. (#616)
segment.target: In Microsoft Office applications, NVDA no longer crashes when speak foreground (NVDA+b) is pressed or when navigating some objects on toolbars. (#616)

segment.source: Fixed incorrect speaking of numbers containing a 0 after a separator; e.g. 1,023. (#593)
segment.target: Fixed incorrect speaking of numbers containing a 0 after a separator; e.g. 1,023. (#593)

segment.source: Adobe Acrobat Pro and Reader 9 no longer crash when closing a file or performing certain other tasks. (#613)
segment.target: Adobe Acrobat Pro and Reader 9 no longer crash when closing a file or performing certain other tasks. (#613)

segment.source: The selection is now announced when control+a is pressed to select all text in some editable text controls such as in Microsoft Word. (#761)
segment.target: The selection is now announced when control+a is pressed to select all text in some editable text controls such as in Microsoft Word. (#761)

segment.source: In Scintilla controls (e.g. Notepad++), text is no longer incorrectly selected when NVDA moves the caret such as during say all. (#746)
segment.target: In Scintilla controls (e.g. Notepad++), text is no longer incorrectly selected when NVDA moves the caret such as during say all. (#746)

segment.source: It is again possible to review the contents of cells in Microsoft Excel with the review cursor.
segment.target: It is again possible to review the contents of cells in Microsoft Excel with the review cursor.

segment.source: NVDA can again read by line in certain problematic textArea fields in Internet Explorer 8. (#467)
segment.target: NVDA can again read by line in certain problematic textArea fields in Internet Explorer 8. (#467)

segment.source: Windows Live Messenger 2009 no longer exits immediately after it is started while NVDA is running. (#677)
segment.target: Windows Live Messenger 2009 no longer exits immediately after it is started while NVDA is running. (#677)

segment.source: In web browsers, It is no longer necessary to press tab to interact with an embedded object (such as Flash content) after pressing enter on the embedded object or returning from another application. (#775)
segment.target: In web browsers, It is no longer necessary to press tab to interact with an embedded object (such as Flash content) after pressing enter on the embedded object or returning from another application. (#775)

segment.source: In Scintilla controls (e.g. Notepad++), the beginning of long lines is no longer truncated when it scrolls off the screen. Also, these long lines will be correctly displayed in braille when they are selected.
segment.target: In Scintilla controls (e.g. Notepad++), the beginning of long lines is no longer truncated when it scrolls off the screen. Also, these long lines will be correctly displayed in braille when they are selected.

segment.source: In Loudtalks, it is now possible to access the contact list.
segment.target: In Loudtalks, it is now possible to access the contact list.

segment.source: The URL of the document and "MSAAHTML Registered Handler" are no longer sometimes spuriously reported in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#811)
segment.target: The URL of the document and "MSAAHTML Registered Handler" are no longer sometimes spuriously reported in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#811)

segment.source: In tree views in the Eclipse IDE, the previously focused item is no longer incorrectly announced when focus moves to a new item.
segment.target: In tree views in the Eclipse IDE, the previously focused item is no longer incorrectly announced when focus moves to a new item.

segment.source: NVDA now functions correctly on a system where the current working directory has been removed from the DLL search path (by setting the CWDIllegalInDllSearch registry entry to 0xFFFFFFFF). Note that this is not relevant to most users. (#907)
segment.target: NVDA now functions correctly on a system where the current working directory has been removed from the DLL search path (by setting the CWDIllegalInDllSearch registry entry to 0xFFFFFFFF). Note that this is not relevant to most users. (#907)

segment.source: When the table navigation commands are used outside of a table in Microsoft Word, "edge of table" is no longer spoken after "not in table". (#921)
segment.target: When the table navigation commands are used outside of a table in Microsoft Word, "edge of table" is no longer spoken after "not in table". (#921)

segment.source: When the table navigation commands cannot move due to being at the edge of a table in Microsoft Word, "edge of table" is now spoken in the configured NVDA language rather than always in English. (#921)
segment.target: When the table navigation commands cannot move due to being at the edge of a table in Microsoft Word, "edge of table" is now spoken in the configured NVDA language rather than always in English. (#921)

segment.source: In Outlook Express, Windows Mail and Windows Live Mail, the state of the checkboxes in message rules lists is now reported. (#576)
segment.target: In Outlook Express, Windows Mail and Windows Live Mail, the state of the checkboxes in message rules lists is now reported. (#576)

segment.source: The description of message rules can now be read in Windows Live Mail 2010.
segment.target: The description of message rules can now be read in Windows Live Mail 2010.

segment.source: This release focuses primarily on bug fixes and improvements to the user experience, including some significant stability fixes.
segment.target: This release focuses primarily on bug fixes and improvements to the user experience, including some significant stability fixes.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to start on a system with no audio output devices. Obviously, a braille display or the Silence synthesiser in conjunction with the Speech Viewer will need to be used for output in this case. (#425)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to start on a system with no audio output devices. Obviously, a braille display or the Silence synthesiser in conjunction with the Speech Viewer will need to be used for output in this case. (#425)

segment.source: A report landmarks checkbox has been added to the Document Formatting settings dialog which allows you to configure whether NVDA should announce landmarks in web documents. For compatibility with the previous release, the option is on by default.
segment.target: A report landmarks checkbox has been added to the Document Formatting settings dialog which allows you to configure whether NVDA should announce landmarks in web documents. For compatibility with the previous release, the option is on by default.

segment.source: If speak command keys is enabled, NVDA will now announce the names of multimedia keys (e.g. play, stop, home page, etc.) on many keyboards when they are pressed. (#472)
segment.target: If speak command keys is enabled, NVDA will now announce the names of multimedia keys (e.g. play, stop, home page, etc.) on many keyboards when they are pressed. (#472)

segment.source: NVDA now announces the word being deleted when pressing control+backspace in controls that support it. (#491)
segment.target: NVDA now announces the word being deleted when pressing control+backspace in controls that support it. (#491)

segment.source: Arrow keys can now be used in the Web formator window to navigate and read the text. (#452)
segment.target: Arrow keys can now be used in the Web formator window to navigate and read the text. (#452)

segment.source: The entry list in the Microsoft Office Outlook address book is now supported.
segment.target: The entry list in the Microsoft Office Outlook address book is now supported.

segment.source: NVDA better supports embedded editable (design mode) documents in Internet Explorer. (#402)
segment.target: NVDA better supports embedded editable (design mode) documents in Internet Explorer. (#402)

segment.source: a new script (nvda+shift+numpadMinus) allows you to move the system focus to the current navigator object.
segment.target: a new script (nvda+shift+numpadMinus) allows you to move the system focus to the current navigator object.

segment.source: New scripts to lock and unlock the left and right mouse buttons. Useful for performing drag and drop operations. shift+numpadDivide to lock/unlock the left, shift+numpadMultiply to lock/unlock the right.
segment.target: New scripts to lock and unlock the left and right mouse buttons. Useful for performing drag and drop operations. shift+numpadDivide to lock/unlock the left, shift+numpadMultiply to lock/unlock the right.

segment.source: New braille translation tables: German 8 dot computer braille, German grade 2, Finnish 8 dot computer braille, Chinese (Hong Kong, Cantonese), Chinese (Taiwan, Manderin). (#344, #369, #415, #450)
segment.target: New braille translation tables: German 8 dot computer braille, German grade 2, Finnish 8 dot computer braille, Chinese (Hong Kong, Cantonese), Chinese (Taiwan, Manderin). (#344, #369, #415, #450)

segment.source: It is now possible to disable the creation of the desktop shortcut (and thus the shortcut key) when installing NVDA. (#518)
segment.target: It is now possible to disable the creation of the desktop shortcut (and thus the shortcut key) when installing NVDA. (#518)

segment.source: NVDA can now use IAccessible2 when present in 64 bit applications. (#479)
segment.target: NVDA can now use IAccessible2 when present in 64 bit applications. (#479)

segment.source: Improved support for live regions in Mozilla applications. (#246)
segment.target: Improved support for live regions in Mozilla applications. (#246)

segment.source: The NVDA Controller Client API is now provided to allow applications to control NVDA; e.g. to speak text, silence speech, display a message in Braille, etc.
segment.target: The NVDA Controller Client API is now provided to allow applications to control NVDA; e.g. to speak text, silence speech, display a message in Braille, etc.

segment.source: Information and error messages are now read in the logon screen in Windows Vista and Windows 7. (#506)
segment.target: Information and error messages are now read in the logon screen in Windows Vista and Windows 7. (#506)

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, PDF interactive forms developed with Adobe LiveCycle are now supported. (#475)
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, PDF interactive forms developed with Adobe LiveCycle are now supported. (#475)

segment.source: In Miranda IM, NVDA now automatically reads incoming messages in chat windows if reporting of dynamic content changes is enabled. Also, commands have been added to report the three most recent messages (NVDA+control+number). (#546)
segment.target: In Miranda IM, NVDA now automatically reads incoming messages in chat windows if reporting of dynamic content changes is enabled. Also, commands have been added to report the three most recent messages (NVDA+control+number). (#546)

segment.source: Input text fields are now supported in Adobe Flash content. (#461)
segment.target: Input text fields are now supported in Adobe Flash content. (#461)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: The extremely verbose keyboard help message in the Windows 7 Start menu is no longer reported.
segment.target: The extremely verbose keyboard help message in the Windows 7 Start menu is no longer reported.

segment.source: The Display synth has now been replaced with a new Speech Viewer. To activate it, choose Speech Viewer from the Tools menu. The speech viewer can be used independently of what ever speech synthesizer you are using. (#44)
segment.target: The Display synth has now been replaced with a new Speech Viewer. To activate it, choose Speech Viewer from the Tools menu. The speech viewer can be used independently of what ever speech synthesizer you are using. (#44)

segment.source: Messages on the braille display will automatically be dismissed if the user presses a key that results in a change such as the focus moving. Previously the message would always stay around for its configured time.
segment.target: Messages on the braille display will automatically be dismissed if the user presses a key that results in a change such as the focus moving. Previously the message would always stay around for its configured time.

segment.source: Setting whether braille should be tethered to the focus or the review cursor (NVDA+control+t) can now be also set from the braille settings dialog, and is also now saved in the user's configuration.
segment.target: Setting whether braille should be tethered to the focus or the review cursor (NVDA+control+t) can now be also set from the braille settings dialog, and is also now saved in the user's configuration.

segment.source: Updated eSpeak speech synthesiser to 1.43.
segment.target: Updated eSpeak speech synthesiser to 1.43.

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 1.8.0.
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 1.8.0.

segment.source: In virtual buffers, the reporting of elements when moving by character or word has been greatly improved. Previously, a lot of irrelevant information was reported and the reporting was very different to that when moving by line. (#490)
segment.target: In virtual buffers, the reporting of elements when moving by character or word has been greatly improved. Previously, a lot of irrelevant information was reported and the reporting was very different to that when moving by line. (#490)

segment.source: The Control key now simply stops speech like other keys, rather than pausing speech. To pause/resume speech, use the shift key.
segment.target: The Control key now simply stops speech like other keys, rather than pausing speech. To pause/resume speech, use the shift key.

segment.source: Table row and column counts are no longer announced when reporting focus changes, as this announcement is rather verbose and usually not useful.
segment.target: Table row and column counts are no longer announced when reporting focus changes, as this announcement is rather verbose and usually not useful.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to start if UI Automation support appears to be available but fails to initialise for some reason. (#483)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to start if UI Automation support appears to be available but fails to initialise for some reason. (#483)

segment.source: The entire contents of a table row is no longer sometimes reported when moving focus inside a cell in Mozilla applications. (#482)
segment.target: The entire contents of a table row is no longer sometimes reported when moving focus inside a cell in Mozilla applications. (#482)

segment.source: NVDA no longer lags for a long time when expanding tree view items that contain a very large amount of sub-items.
segment.target: NVDA no longer lags for a long time when expanding tree view items that contain a very large amount of sub-items.

segment.source: When listing SAPI 5 voices, NVDA now tries to detect buggy voices and excludes them from the Voice Settings dialog and synthesiser settings ring. Previously, when there was just one problematic voice, NVDA's SAPI 5 driver would sometimes fail to start.
segment.target: When listing SAPI 5 voices, NVDA now tries to detect buggy voices and excludes them from the Voice Settings dialog and synthesiser settings ring. Previously, when there was just one problematic voice, NVDA's SAPI 5 driver would sometimes fail to start.

segment.source: Virtual buffers now honour the report object shortcut keys setting found in the Object Presentation dialog. (#486)
segment.target: Virtual buffers now honour the report object shortcut keys setting found in the Object Presentation dialog. (#486)

segment.source: In virtual buffers, row/column coordinates are no longer incorrectly read for row and column headers when reporting of tables is disabled.
segment.target: In virtual buffers, row/column coordinates are no longer incorrectly read for row and column headers when reporting of tables is disabled.

segment.source: In virtual buffers, row/column coordinates are now correctly read when you leave a table and then re-enter the same table cell without visiting another cell first; e.g. pressing upArrow then downArrow on the first cell of a table. (#378)
segment.target: In virtual buffers, row/column coordinates are now correctly read when you leave a table and then re-enter the same table cell without visiting another cell first; e.g. pressing upArrow then downArrow on the first cell of a table. (#378)

segment.source: Blank lines in Microsoft Word documents and Microsoft HTML edit controls are now shown appropriately on braille displays. Previously NVDA was displaying the current sentence on the display, not the current line for these situations. (#420)
segment.target: Blank lines in Microsoft Word documents and Microsoft HTML edit controls are now shown appropriately on braille displays. Previously NVDA was displaying the current sentence on the display, not the current line for these situations. (#420)

segment.source: Multiple security fixes when running NVDA at Windows logon and on other secure desktops. (#515)
segment.target: Multiple security fixes when running NVDA at Windows logon and on other secure desktops. (#515)

segment.source: The cursor position (caret) is now correctly updated when performing a Say All that goes off the bottom of the screen, in standard Windows edit fields and Microsoft Word documents. (#418)
segment.target: The cursor position (caret) is now correctly updated when performing a Say All that goes off the bottom of the screen, in standard Windows edit fields and Microsoft Word documents. (#418)

segment.source: In virtual buffers, text is no longer incorrectly included for images inside links and clickables that are marked as being irrelevant to screen readers. (#423)
segment.target: In virtual buffers, text is no longer incorrectly included for images inside links and clickables that are marked as being irrelevant to screen readers. (#423)

segment.source: Fixes to the laptop keyboard layout. (#517)
segment.target: Fixes to the laptop keyboard layout. (#517)

segment.source: When Braille is tethered to review when you focus on a Dos console window, the review cursor can now properly navigate the text in the console.
segment.target: When Braille is tethered to review when you focus on a Dos console window, the review cursor can now properly navigate the text in the console.

segment.source: While working with TeamTalk3 or TeamTalk4 Classic, the VU meter progress bar in the main window is no longer announced as it updates. Also, special characters can be read properly in the incoming chat window.
segment.target: While working with TeamTalk3 or TeamTalk4 Classic, the VU meter progress bar in the main window is no longer announced as it updates. Also, special characters can be read properly in the incoming chat window.

segment.source: Items are no longer spoken twice in the Windows 7 Start Menu. (#474)
segment.target: Items are no longer spoken twice in the Windows 7 Start Menu. (#474)

segment.source: Activating same-page links in Firefox 3.6 appropriately moves the cursor in the virtualBuffer to the correct place on the page.
segment.target: Activating same-page links in Firefox 3.6 appropriately moves the cursor in the virtualBuffer to the correct place on the page.

segment.source: Fixed the issue where some text was not rendered in Adobe Reader in certain PDF documents.
segment.target: Fixed the issue where some text was not rendered in Adobe Reader in certain PDF documents.

segment.source: NVDA no longer incorrectly speaks certain numbers separated by a dash; e.g. 500-1000. (#547)
segment.target: NVDA no longer incorrectly speaks certain numbers separated by a dash; e.g. 500-1000. (#547)

segment.source: In Windows XP, NVDA no longer causes Internet Explorer to freeze when toggling checkboxes in Windows Update. (#477)
segment.target: In Windows XP, NVDA no longer causes Internet Explorer to freeze when toggling checkboxes in Windows Update. (#477)

segment.source: When using the in-built eSpeak synthesiser, simultaneous speech and beeps no longer intermittently cause freezes on some systems. This was most noticeable, for example, when copying large amounts of data in Windows Explorer.
segment.target: When using the in-built eSpeak synthesiser, simultaneous speech and beeps no longer intermittently cause freezes on some systems. This was most noticeable, for example, when copying large amounts of data in Windows Explorer.

segment.source: NVDA no longer announces that a Firefox document has become busy (e.g. due to an update or refresh) when that document is in the background. This also caused the status bar of the foreground application to be spuriously announced.
segment.target: NVDA no longer announces that a Firefox document has become busy (e.g. due to an update or refresh) when that document is in the background. This also caused the status bar of the foreground application to be spuriously announced.

segment.source: When switching Windows keyboard layouts (with control+shift or alt+shift), the full name of the layout is reported in both speech and braille. Previously it was only reported in speech, and alternative layouts (e.g. Dvorak) were not reported at all.
segment.target: When switching Windows keyboard layouts (with control+shift or alt+shift), the full name of the layout is reported in both speech and braille. Previously it was only reported in speech, and alternative layouts (e.g. Dvorak) were not reported at all.

segment.source: If reporting of tables is disabled, table information is no longer announced when the focus changes.
segment.target: If reporting of tables is disabled, table information is no longer announced when the focus changes.

segment.source: Certain standard tree view controls in 64 bit applications (e.g. the Contents tree view in Microsoft HTML Help) are now accessible. (#473)
segment.target: Certain standard tree view controls in 64 bit applications (e.g. the Contents tree view in Microsoft HTML Help) are now accessible. (#473)

segment.source: Fixed some problems with logging of messages containing non-ASCII characters. This could cause spurious errors in some cases on non-English systems. (#581)
segment.target: Fixed some problems with logging of messages containing non-ASCII characters. This could cause spurious errors in some cases on non-English systems. (#581)

segment.source: The information in the About NVDA dialog now appears in the user's configured language instead of always appearing in English. (#586)
segment.target: The information in the About NVDA dialog now appears in the user's configured language instead of always appearing in English. (#586)

segment.source: Problems are no longer encountered when using the synthesiser settings ring after the voice is changed to one which has less settings than the previous voice.
segment.target: Problems are no longer encountered when using the synthesiser settings ring after the voice is changed to one which has less settings than the previous voice.

segment.source: In Skype 4.2, contact names are no longer spoken twice in the contact list.
segment.target: In Skype 4.2, contact names are no longer spoken twice in the contact list.

segment.source: Fixed some potentially major memory leaks in the GUI and in virtual buffers. (#590, #591)
segment.target: Fixed some potentially major memory leaks in the GUI and in virtual buffers. (#590, #591)

segment.source: Work around a nasty bug in some SAPI 4 synthesisers which was causing frequent errors and crashes in NVDA. (#597)
segment.target: Work around a nasty bug in some SAPI 4 synthesisers which was causing frequent errors and crashes in NVDA. (#597)

segment.source: Major highlights of this release include support for 64 bit editions of Windows; greatly improved support for Microsoft Internet Explorer and Adobe Reader documents; support for Windows 7; reading of the Windows logon, control+alt+delete and User Account Control (UAC) screens; and the ability to interact with Adobe Flash and Sun Java content on web pages. There have also been several significant stability fixes and improvements to the general user experience.
segment.target: Major highlights of this release include support for 64 bit editions of Windows; greatly improved support for Microsoft Internet Explorer and Adobe Reader documents; support for Windows 7; reading of the Windows logon, control+alt+delete and User Account Control (UAC) screens; and the ability to interact with Adobe Flash and Sun Java content on web pages. There have also been several significant stability fixes and improvements to the general user experience.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: Official support for 64 bit editions of Windows! (#309)
segment.target: Official support for 64 bit editions of Windows! (#309)

segment.source: Added a synthesizer driver for the Newfon synthesizer. Note that this requires a special version of Newfon. (#206)
segment.target: Added a synthesizer driver for the Newfon synthesizer. Note that this requires a special version of Newfon. (#206)

segment.source: In virtual buffers, focus mode and browse mode can now be reported using sounds instead of speech. This is enabled by default. It can be configured from the Virtual buffers dialog. (#244)
segment.target: In virtual buffers, focus mode and browse mode can now be reported using sounds instead of speech. This is enabled by default. It can be configured from the Virtual buffers dialog. (#244)

segment.source: NVDA no longer cancels speech when volume control keys are pressed on the keyboard, allowing the user to change the volume and listen to actual results immediately. (#287)
segment.target: NVDA no longer cancels speech when volume control keys are pressed on the keyboard, allowing the user to change the volume and listen to actual results immediately. (#287)

segment.source: Completely rewritten support for Microsoft Internet Explorer and Adobe Reader documents. This support has been unified with the core support used for Mozilla Gecko, so features such as fast page rendering, extensive quick navigation, links list, text selection, auto focus mode and braille support are now available with these documents.
segment.target: Completely rewritten support for Microsoft Internet Explorer and Adobe Reader documents. This support has been unified with the core support used for Mozilla Gecko, so features such as fast page rendering, extensive quick navigation, links list, text selection, auto focus mode and braille support are now available with these documents.

segment.source: Improved support for the date selection control found in the Windows Vista Date / Time properties dialog.
segment.target: Improved support for the date selection control found in the Windows Vista Date / Time properties dialog.

segment.source: improved support for the Modern XP/Vista start menu (specifically the all programs, and places menus). Appropriate level information is now announced.
segment.target: improved support for the Modern XP/Vista start menu (specifically the all programs, and places menus). Appropriate level information is now announced.

segment.source: The amount of text that is announced when moving the mouse is now configurable from the Mouse settings dialog. A choice of paragraph, line, word or character can be made.
segment.target: The amount of text that is announced when moving the mouse is now configurable from the Mouse settings dialog. A choice of paragraph, line, word or character can be made.

segment.source: announce spelling errors under the cursor in Microsoft Word.
segment.target: announce spelling errors under the cursor in Microsoft Word.

segment.source: support for the Microsoft Word 2007 spell checker. Partial support may be available for prior Microsoft Word versions.
segment.target: support for the Microsoft Word 2007 spell checker. Partial support may be available for prior Microsoft Word versions.

segment.source: Better support for Windows Live Mail. Plain text messages can now be read and both the plain text and HTML message composers are useable.
segment.target: Better support for Windows Live Mail. Plain text messages can now be read and both the plain text and HTML message composers are useable.

segment.source: In Windows Vista, if the user moves to the secure desktop (either because a UAC control dialog appeared, or because control+alt+delete was pressed), NVDA will announce the fact that the user is now on the secure desktop.
segment.target: In Windows Vista, if the user moves to the secure desktop (either because a UAC control dialog appeared, or because control+alt+delete was pressed), NVDA will announce the fact that the user is now on the secure desktop.

segment.source: NVDA can announce text under the mouse within dos console windows.
segment.target: NVDA can announce text under the mouse within dos console windows.

segment.source: Support for UI Automation via the UI Automation client API available in Windows 7, as well as fixes to improve the experience of NVDA in Windows 7.
segment.target: Support for UI Automation via the UI Automation client API available in Windows 7, as well as fixes to improve the experience of NVDA in Windows 7.

segment.source: NVDA can be configured to start automatically after you log on to Windows. The option is in the General Settings dialog.
segment.target: NVDA can be configured to start automatically after you log on to Windows. The option is in the General Settings dialog.

segment.source: NVDA can read secure Windows screens such as the Windows logon, control+alt+delete and User Account Control (UAC) screens in Windows XP and above. Reading of the Windows logon screen can be configured from the General Settings dialog. (#97)
segment.target: NVDA can read secure Windows screens such as the Windows logon, control+alt+delete and User Account Control (UAC) screens in Windows XP and above. Reading of the Windows logon screen can be configured from the General Settings dialog. (#97)

segment.source: Added a driver for the Optelec ALVA BC6 series braille displays.
segment.target: Added a driver for the Optelec ALVA BC6 series braille displays.

segment.source: When browsing web documents, you can now press n and shift+n to skip forward and backward past blocks of links, respectively.
segment.target: When browsing web documents, you can now press n and shift+n to skip forward and backward past blocks of links, respectively.

segment.source: When browsing web documents, ARIA landmarks are now reported, and you can move forward and backward through them using d and shift+d, respectively. (#192)
segment.target: When browsing web documents, ARIA landmarks are now reported, and you can move forward and backward through them using d and shift+d, respectively. (#192)

segment.source: The Links List dialog available when browsing web documents has now become an Elements List dialog which can list links, headings and landmarks. Headings and landmarks are presented hierarchically. (#363)
segment.target: The Links List dialog available when browsing web documents has now become an Elements List dialog which can list links, headings and landmarks. Headings and landmarks are presented hierarchically. (#363)

segment.source: The new Elements List dialog contains a "Filter by" field which allows you to filter the list to contain only those items including the text that was typed. (#173)
segment.target: The new Elements List dialog contains a "Filter by" field which allows you to filter the list to contain only those items including the text that was typed. (#173)

segment.source: Portable versions of NVDA now look in the 'userConfig' directory inside the NVDA directory, for the user's configuration. Like for the installer version, this keeps the user's configuration separate from NVDA itself.
segment.target: Portable versions of NVDA now look in the 'userConfig' directory inside the NVDA directory, for the user's configuration. Like for the installer version, this keeps the user's configuration separate from NVDA itself.

segment.source: Custom app modules, braille display drivers and synth drivers can now be stored in the user's configuration directory. (#337)
segment.target: Custom app modules, braille display drivers and synth drivers can now be stored in the user's configuration directory. (#337)

segment.source: Virtual buffers are now rendered in the background, allowing the user to interact with the system to some extent during the rendering process. The user will be notified that the document is being rendered if it takes longer than a second.
segment.target: Virtual buffers are now rendered in the background, allowing the user to interact with the system to some extent during the rendering process. The user will be notified that the document is being rendered if it takes longer than a second.

segment.source: If NVDA detects that it has frozen for some reason, it will automatically pass all keystrokes through so that the user has a better chance of recovering the system.
segment.target: If NVDA detects that it has frozen for some reason, it will automatically pass all keystrokes through so that the user has a better chance of recovering the system.

segment.source: Support for ARIA drag and drop in Mozilla Gecko. (#239)
segment.target: Support for ARIA drag and drop in Mozilla Gecko. (#239)

segment.source: The document title and current line or selection is now spoken when you move focus inside a virtual buffer. This makes the behaviour when moving focus into virtual buffers consistent with that for normal document objects. (#210)
segment.target: The document title and current line or selection is now spoken when you move focus inside a virtual buffer. This makes the behaviour when moving focus into virtual buffers consistent with that for normal document objects. (#210)

segment.source: In virtual buffers, you can now interact with embedded objects (such as Adobe Flash and Sun Java content) by pressing enter on the object. If it is accessible, you can then tab around it like any other application. To return focus to the document, press NVDA+space. (#431)
segment.target: In virtual buffers, you can now interact with embedded objects (such as Adobe Flash and Sun Java content) by pressing enter on the object. If it is accessible, you can then tab around it like any other application. To return focus to the document, press NVDA+space. (#431)

segment.source: In virtual buffers, o and shift+o move to the next and previous embedded object, respectively.
segment.target: In virtual buffers, o and shift+o move to the next and previous embedded object, respectively.

segment.source: NVDA can now fully access applications running as administrator in Windows Vista and later. You must install an official release of NVDA for this to work. This does not work for portable versions and snapshots. (#397)
segment.target: NVDA can now fully access applications running as administrator in Windows Vista and later. You must install an official release of NVDA for this to work. This does not work for portable versions and snapshots. (#397)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: NVDA no longer announces "NVDA started" when it starts.
segment.target: NVDA no longer announces "NVDA started" when it starts.

segment.source: The startup and exit sounds are now played using NVDA's configured audio output device instead of the Windows default audio output device. (#164)
segment.target: The startup and exit sounds are now played using NVDA's configured audio output device instead of the Windows default audio output device. (#164)

segment.source: Progress bar reporting has been improved. Most notably you can now configure NVDA to announce via both speech and beeps at the same time.
segment.target: Progress bar reporting has been improved. Most notably you can now configure NVDA to announce via both speech and beeps at the same time.

segment.source: Some generic roles, such as pane, application and frame, are no longer reported on focus unless the control is unnamed.
segment.target: Some generic roles, such as pane, application and frame, are no longer reported on focus unless the control is unnamed.

segment.source: The review copy command (NVDA+f10) copies the text from the start marker up to and including the current review position, rather than excluding the current position. This allows the last character of a line to be copied, which was not previously possible. (#430)
segment.target: The review copy command (NVDA+f10) copies the text from the start marker up to and including the current review position, rather than excluding the current position. This allows the last character of a line to be copied, which was not previously possible. (#430)

segment.source: the navigatorObject_where script (ctrl+NVDA+numpad5) has been removed. This key combination did not work on some keyboards, nore was the script found to be that useful.
segment.target: the navigatorObject_where script (ctrl+NVDA+numpad5) has been removed. This key combination did not work on some keyboards, nore was the script found to be that useful.

segment.source: the navigatorObject_currentDimentions script has been remapped to NVDA+numpadDelete. The old key combination did not work on some keyboards. This script also now reports the width and height of the object instead of the right/bottom coordinates.
segment.target: the navigatorObject_currentDimentions script has been remapped to NVDA+numpadDelete. The old key combination did not work on some keyboards. This script also now reports the width and height of the object instead of the right/bottom coordinates.

segment.source: Improved performance (especially on netbooks) when many beeps occur in quick succession; e.g. fast mouse movement with audio coordinates enabled. (#396)
segment.target: Improved performance (especially on netbooks) when many beeps occur in quick succession; e.g. fast mouse movement with audio coordinates enabled. (#396)

segment.source: The NVDA error sound is no longer played in release candidates and final releases. Note that errors are still logged.
segment.target: The NVDA error sound is no longer played in release candidates and final releases. Note that errors are still logged.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: When NVDA is run from an 8.3 dos path, but it is installed in the related long path (e.g. progra~1 verses program files) NVDA will correctly identify that it is an installed copy and properly load the user's settings.
segment.target: When NVDA is run from an 8.3 dos path, but it is installed in the related long path (e.g. progra~1 verses program files) NVDA will correctly identify that it is an installed copy and properly load the user's settings.

segment.source: speaking the title of the current foreground window with nvda+t now works correctly when in menus.
segment.target: speaking the title of the current foreground window with nvda+t now works correctly when in menus.

segment.source: braille no longer shows useless information in its focus context such as unlabeled panes.
segment.target: braille no longer shows useless information in its focus context such as unlabeled panes.

segment.source: stop announcing some useless information when the focus changes such as root panes, layered panes and scroll panes in Java or Lotus applications.
segment.target: stop announcing some useless information when the focus changes such as root panes, layered panes and scroll panes in Java or Lotus applications.

segment.source: Make the keyword search field in Windows Help (CHM) viewer much more usable. Due to buggyness in that control, the current keyword could not be read as it would be continually changing.
segment.target: Make the keyword search field in Windows Help (CHM) viewer much more usable. Due to buggyness in that control, the current keyword could not be read as it would be continually changing.

segment.source: report correct page numbers in Microsoft Word if the page numbering has been specifically offset in the document.
segment.target: report correct page numbers in Microsoft Word if the page numbering has been specifically offset in the document.

segment.source: Better support for edit fields found in Microsoft Word dialogs (e.g. the Font dialog). It is now possible to navigate these controls with the arrow keys.
segment.target: Better support for edit fields found in Microsoft Word dialogs (e.g. the Font dialog). It is now possible to navigate these controls with the arrow keys.

segment.source: better support for Dos consoles. specifically: NVDA can now read the content of particular consoles it always used to think were blank. Pressing control+break no longer terminates NVDA.
segment.target: better support for Dos consoles. specifically: NVDA can now read the content of particular consoles it always used to think were blank. Pressing control+break no longer terminates NVDA.

segment.source: On Windows Vista and above, the NVDA installer now starts NVDA with normal user privileges when requested to run NVDA on the finish screen.
segment.target: On Windows Vista and above, the NVDA installer now starts NVDA with normal user privileges when requested to run NVDA on the finish screen.

segment.source: Backspace is now handled correctly when speaking typed words. (#306)
segment.target: Backspace is now handled correctly when speaking typed words. (#306)

segment.source: Don't incorrectly report "Start menu" for certain context menus in Windows Explorer/the Windows shell. (#257)
segment.target: Don't incorrectly report "Start menu" for certain context menus in Windows Explorer/the Windows shell. (#257)

segment.source: NVDA now correctly handles ARIA labels in Mozilla Gecko when there is no other useful content. (#156)
segment.target: NVDA now correctly handles ARIA labels in Mozilla Gecko when there is no other useful content. (#156)

segment.source: NVDA no longer incorrectly enables focus mode automatically for editable text fields which update their value when the focus changes; e.g. http://tigerdirect.com/. (#220)
segment.target: NVDA no longer incorrectly enables focus mode automatically for editable text fields which update their value when the focus changes; e.g. http://tigerdirect.com/. (#220)

segment.source: NVDA will now attempt to recover from some situations which would previously cause it to freeze completely. It may take up to 10 seconds for NVDA to detect and recover from such a freeze.
